Title: Python Developer
Description:
TeamSystem è una Tech Company che da oltre 40 anni supporta la digitalizzazione. ​Siamo leader in Europa nel settore delle soluzioni e dei servizi digitali per le imprese di ogni dimensione e settore. Aiutiamo le aziende a crescere, a migliorare i loro processi e a essere più competitive sul mercato.​

Siamo diventati la società di riferimento sulla Digital Innovation per le più importanti organizzazioni del contesto economico italiano. Offriamo prodotti e servizi innovativi in ambito ERP, CRM, HR, Fatturazione Elettronica, Digital Payments, Business Intelligence, AI e molto altro. ​

Siamo sempre alla ricerca di nuove sfide e la nostra missione è quella di portare il digitale in ogni impresa. ​

Come? Fornendo soluzioni innovative che semplifichino e ottimizzino i processi dei nostri clienti. ​

E non è tutto: vogliamo creare valore per le nostre persone promuovendo una cultura di eccellenza, innovazione e pratiche di business etiche e responsabili.​ Per questo investiamo sulle competenze, sul benessere e sulla crescita professionale dei nostri collaboratori.




Nell’ottica di un miglioramento continuo delle attività di analisi e per raggiungere livelli d’eccellenza nella qualità e gestione dei dati trattati, il team di Data, AI & Analytics è alla ricerca di una figura di Python Developer che gestisca le attività sulle tematiche AI e supporti i vari usecase sulla nostra piattaforma. Le attività prevedono:




Sviluppo e manutenzione di una piattaforma basata su agenti AI (agentic AI) per l'integrazione di funzionalità avanzate in ambito Data, AI e Analytics.
Progettazione e implementazione di architetture software scalabili per orchestrare agenti intelligenti, con focus sull'ottimizzazione delle prestazioni.
Sviluppo di pipeline per l'elaborazione di dati strutturati e non strutturati, inclusa l'integrazione con database relazionali e database vettoriali.
Implementazione di modelli AI, inclusi LLM (Large Language Models) e tecnologie di fine-tuning o prompting, per soddisfare specifici use case aziendali.
Collaborazione interdisciplinare con data scientist, software/prompt engineers e stakeholder di prodotto per definire requisiti e priorità di sviluppo.
Monitoraggio e manutenzione delle soluzioni AI in produzione, garantendo affidabilità, sicurezza e conformità alle normative.
Documentazione tecnica chiara e dettagliata per facilitare il trasferimento di conoscenze all'interno del team.




Per svolgere le attività saranno utili:

Conoscenza avanzata di Python, con esperienza in librerie per il machine learning e il deep learning (ad esempio TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Esperienza nello sviluppo di API e microservizi utilizzando framework come FastAPI, Flask o Django.
Familiarità con LLM e agenti AI, inclusa l'implementazione di catene di agenti e tecniche di Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Esperienza con database vettoriali (ad esempio Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus, MongoDB) e con strumenti per la gestione di dati strutturati (ad esempio SQL, PostgreSQL).
Conoscenza di architetture basate su container (Docker, Kubernetes) per il deployment di applicazioni scalabili.
Capacità di lavorare con strumenti di version control come Git e di gestire workflow CI/CD.
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di strumenti cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP).




Soft Skill

IMPRENDITORIALITÀ – Puntiamo all’eccellenza, al raggiungimento dei risultati e alla crescita dell’azienda superando gli interessi individuali; agiamo per il bene comune e per realizzare la strategia condivisa. Ci impegniamo in prima persona con spirito d’iniziativa e guidando chi sta intorno a noi. Siamo responsabili della qualità del nostro lavoro e supportiamo gli altri nel dare il meglio, pronti a sfidare lo status quo per comprendere, anticipare e soddisfare i bisogni del cliente;
INNOVAZIONE - Progettiamo, sperimentiamo e realizziamo nuove cose e nuovi modi di lavorare, ricercando soluzioni creative e imparando dagli errori. Siamo curiosi e valorizziamo leintuizioni di tutti, aperti ai contributi degli altri e sempre alla ricerca dell’idea migliore, dentro e fuori dall’organizzazione. Anticipiamo il cambiamento e ci impegniamo a renderlo reale.
GROWTH MINDSET – è l'atteggiamento che ci spinge a cercare continuamente nuove sfide, opportunità e apprendimenti, senza lasciarci scoraggiare dagli ostacoli o dai fallimenti. È la mentalità che ci permette di crescere come persone e come professionisti, sfruttando al meglio il nostro potenziale e quello degli altri.
INCLUSIONE - Nei nostri team diamo spazio ai diversi talenti che le persone incarnane, creiamo opportunità per farli crescere. Dalla pluralità di approcci e visioni costruiamo i valori e gli obiettivi comuni. Crediamo che dalla sintesi di diverse esperienze, conoscenze e sensibilità si possano generare le miglio risoluzioni e per questo creiamo le condizioni affinché tutti si possano esprimere al meglio. Rispettiamo gli individui e i punti di vista differenti dal nostro, vivendoli come opportunità di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:




WELLBEING: siamo tra le prime aziende italiane a puntare sul modello della settimana corta. Il venerdì pomeriggio non lavoriamo per dedicarci ai nostri interessi personali e/o ai nostri affetti. E per metterti nelle condizioni migliori per farlo, è previsto per ogni persona un piano di welfare individuale e personalizzato, creato appositamente per supportare il benessere tuo e delle persone che hai accanto;
DIVERSITÀ E INCLUSIVITÀ: siamo un luogo dove la diversità e l'inclusività sono il fulcro di ciò che siamo e di come lavoriamo. Promuoviamo una cultura aperta, collaborativa e rispettosa delle differenze. Il nostro modello di leadership è partecipativo e basato sui concetti di fiducia e sviluppo del talento;
FLESSIBILITÀ: lo smart working è parte integrante della nostra WoW (way of working) e per supportarti in tal senso è stato previsto uno smart working pack, ovvero un kit di dotazioni necessario a far si che la tua esperienza lavorativa da remoto sia congrua ed efficace – il kit comprende anche la connessione internet.
SVILUPPO E CRESCITA: abbiamo forte attenzione alla valorizzazione del talento individuale e alla volontà di consolidamento delle competenze tecniche e di leadership delle nostre persone. Potrai accedere ad una vasta library di corsi per lo sviluppo di competenze hard e soft, in linea con le esigenze di sviluppo del tuo ruolo. Inoltre, sempre a supporto del talento, sono previsti piani di sviluppo personalizzati e organizzati in collaborazione con le principali business school italiane.
IMPATTO: Pensiamo che il nostro business abbia un impatto non solo in termini di profitto. Ci impegniamo a generare valore per i nostri clienti, i nostri partner, ma siamo consci della nostra responsabilità sociale e ambientale e aspiriamo a fare la differenza in ogni nostro progetto.




Sede di lavoro: Milano, Roma

Come? Fornendo soluzioni innovative che semplifichino e ottimizzino i processi dei nostri clienti. ​

E non è tutto: vogliamo creare valore per le nostre persone promuovendo una cultura di eccellenza, innovazione e pratiche di business etiche e responsabili.​ Per questo investiamo sulle competenze, sul benessere e sulla crescita professionale dei nostri collaboratori.


Nell’ottica di un miglioramento continuo delle attività di analisi e per raggiungere livelli d’eccellenza nella qualità e gestione dei dati trattati, il team di Data, AI & Analytics è alla ricerca di una figura di Python Developer che gestisca le attività sulle tematiche AI e supporti i vari usecase sulla nostra piattaforma. Le attività prevedono:


  • Sviluppo e manutenzione di una piattaforma basata su agenti AI (agentic AI) per l'integrazione di funzionalità avanzate in ambito Data, AI e Analytics.
  • Progettazione e implementazione di architetture software scalabili per orchestrare agenti intelligenti, con focus sull'ottimizzazione delle prestazioni.
  • Sviluppo di pipeline per l'elaborazione di dati strutturati e non strutturati, inclusa l'integrazione con database relazionali e database vettoriali.
  • Implementazione di modelli AI, inclusi LLM (Large Language Models) e tecnologie di fine-tuning o prompting, per soddisfare specifici use case aziendali.
  • Collaborazione interdisciplinare con data scientist, software/prompt engineers e stakeholder di prodotto per definire requisiti e priorità di sviluppo.
  • Monitoraggio e manutenzione delle soluzioni AI in produzione, garantendo affidabilità, sicurezza e conformità alle normative.
  • Documentazione tecnica chiara e dettagliata per facilitare il trasferimento di conoscenze all'interno del team.


Per svolgere le attività saranno utili:

  • Conoscenza avanzata di Python, con esperienza in librerie per il machine learning e il deep learning (ad esempio TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
  • Esperienza nello sviluppo di API e microservizi utilizzando framework come FastAPI, Flask o Django.
  • Familiarità con LLM e agenti AI, inclusa l'implementazione di catene di agenti e tecniche di Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
  • Esperienza con database vettoriali (ad esempio Pinecone, Weaviate, Milvus, MongoDB) e con strumenti per la gestione di dati strutturati (ad esempio SQL, PostgreSQL).
  • Conoscenza di architetture basate su container (Docker, Kubernetes) per il deployment di applicazioni scalabili.
  • Capacità di lavorare con strumenti di version control come Git e di gestire workflow CI/CD.
  • Esperienza nell’utilizzo di strumenti cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP).


Soft Skill

  • IMPRENDITORIALITÀ – Puntiamo all’eccellenza, al raggiungimento dei risultati e alla crescita dell’azienda superando gli interessi individuali; agiamo per il bene comune e per realizzare la strategia condivisa. Ci impegniamo in prima persona con spirito d’iniziativa e guidando chi sta intorno a noi. Siamo responsabili della qualità del nostro lavoro e supportiamo gli altri nel dare il meglio, pronti a sfidare lo status quo per comprendere, anticipare e soddisfare i bisogni del cliente;
  • INNOVAZIONE - Progettiamo, sperimentiamo e realizziamo nuove cose e nuovi modi di lavorare, ricercando soluzioni creative e imparando dagli errori. Siamo curiosi e valorizziamo leintuizioni di tutti, aperti ai contributi degli altri e sempre alla ricerca dell’idea migliore, dentro e fuori dall’organizzazione. Anticipiamo il cambiamento e ci impegniamo a renderlo reale.
  • GROWTH MINDSET – è l'atteggiamento che ci spinge a cercare continuamente nuove sfide, opportunità e apprendimenti, senza lasciarci scoraggiare dagli ostacoli o dai fallimenti. È la mentalità che ci permette di crescere come persone e come professionisti, sfruttando al meglio il nostro potenziale e quello degli altri.
  • INCLUSIONE - Nei nostri team diamo spazio ai diversi talenti che le persone incarnane, creiamo opportunità per farli crescere. Dalla pluralità di approcci e visioni costruiamo i valori e gli obiettivi comuni. Crediamo che dalla sintesi di diverse esperienze, conoscenze e sensibilità si possano generare le miglio risoluzioni e per questo creiamo le condizioni affinché tutti si possano esprimere al meglio. Rispettiamo gli individui e i punti di vista differenti dal nostro, vivendoli come opportunità di crescita.


Cosa offriamo:


  • WELLBEING: siamo tra le prime aziende italiane a puntare sul modello della settimana corta. Il venerdì pomeriggio non lavoriamo per dedicarci ai nostri interessi personali e/o ai nostri affetti. E per metterti nelle condizioni migliori per farlo, è previsto per ogni persona un piano di welfare individuale e personalizzato, creato appositamente per supportare il benessere tuo e delle persone che hai accanto;
  • DIVERSITÀ E INCLUSIVITÀ: siamo un luogo dove la diversità e l'inclusività sono il fulcro di ciò che siamo e di come lavoriamo. Promuoviamo una cultura aperta, collaborativa e rispettosa delle differenze. Il nostro modello di leadership è partecipativo e basato sui concetti di fiducia e sviluppo del talento;
  • FLESSIBILITÀ: lo smart working è parte integrante della nostra WoW (way of working) e per supportarti in tal senso è stato previsto uno smart working pack, ovvero un kit di dotazioni necessario a far si che la tua esperienza lavorativa da remoto sia congrua ed efficace – il kit comprende anche la connessione internet.
  • SVILUPPO E CRESCITA: abbiamo forte attenzione alla valorizzazione del talento individuale e alla volontà di consolidamento delle competenze tecniche e di leadership delle nostre persone. Potrai accedere ad una vasta library di corsi per lo sviluppo di competenze hard e soft, in linea con le esigenze di sviluppo del tuo ruolo. Inoltre, sempre a supporto del talento, sono previsti piani di sviluppo personalizzati e organizzati in collaborazione con le principali business school italiane.
  • IMPATTO: Pensiamo che il nostro business abbia un impatto non solo in termini di profitto. Ci impegniamo a generare valore per i nostri clienti, i nostri partner, ma siamo consci della nostra responsabilità sociale e ambientale e aspiriamo a fare la differenza in ogni nostro progetto.


Sede di lavoro: Milano, Roma

Title: Scientist III, Data Sciences
Description:
Work Schedule

First Shift (Days)

Environmental Conditions

Office

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

Location/Division Specific Information

The team focuses on commercial audience generation through audience segmentation, time-to-event analysis, recommendation engines, generative AI, and other forms of predictive modeling. You will work closely with experts throughout the company to develop tailored targeting strategies. Your work will be seen and used by fellow data scientists, collaborators within the business, sales representatives, and customers of Thermo Fisher. You will be expected to learn quickly and offer creative and effective solutions to novel challenges.

You will report to a member of the data science team and operate as a key asset within the Corporate Data Science Center of Excellence, a team comprised of data scientists, data engineers, business analysts, program/product managers, and others.

Key Responsibilities


Identify and embed within business functions throughout the company with high data science potential.
Move quickly to build proof of concepts, scalable solutions, and anything else required to drive business value quickly.
Leverage modern tools and techniques to develop novel insights.
Promote standard methodologies in the field, encompassing data warehousing, performance monitoring, and a balanced approach.
Work with senior members to build novel audience-creation and targeting strategies
Voracious pursuit of knowledge and an unwavering dedication to the scientific process


Keys to Success:

Education


Graduate degree in a quantitative field, such as statistics, economics, mathematics, etc.


Experience


Proven track record (3 to 6 years) applying industry standard data science tools to tackle previously unsolved problems
Ability to work independently with minimal day-to-day oversight


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities


Extensive knowledge and application of the scientific process in industry
Command of statistical topics, including distributions, hypothesis testing, and experiment design.
Sophisticated technical proficiency in Python, R, SQL, and others.
Proficiency with distributed computational frameworks, such as Spark
Foundational understanding in digital marketing, sales operations, and key performance indicators
Fluent English both written and spoken is required.

Title: 12687 - AI and Climate Change/Environment Researcher
Company: CMCC Foundation - Centro Euro Mediterraneo sui Cambiamenti Climatici
Description:
CMCC Position cod. 12687

Climate Solutions Researcher

Deadline: March 15th, 2025

What We Are Looking For

The CMCC European Institute on Economics and the Environment (EIEE) is looking to hire

a talented and motivated early career researcher to join our interdisciplinary team at the intersection of artificial intelligence and climate change research. The ideal candidate will bring innovative machine learning approaches to address complex environmental challenges, contributing to cutting-edge research that has the potential to make a significant impact on understanding and mitigating climate change.

About Us

CMCC Foundation is a cross-cutting scientific research center on climate change and its interactions with the environment, society, the world of business, and policymakers. Our work aims to stimulate sustainable growth, protect the environment, and develop strategies for the adaptation and mitigation of climate change. CMCC's core objective is to conduct cutting-edge science, to train the next generation of scientists at both national and international levels, and to be a beacon for climate modelling.

CMCC pursues fundamental and applied science with utmost scientific integrity, prioritizing data-driven science and providing data, information, and research results that can support informed public debate and decision-making processes. To achieve climate research objectives at the highest international standards, we invest in training all our talents, and strive to create a workplace where everyone can excel.

At CMCC you will find a strong, professional environment. Join an inclusive community that values diversity, where every voice is heard and respected. Help foster a culture of innovation and societal change, where individuals from all backgrounds can thrive and succeed.

To learn more about this opportunity and submit your application, please refer to the following:

Responsibilities

The successful candidate is expected to work on the following tasks which include but are not limited to:


Developing and implementing advanced machine learning and deep learning algorithms to analyze climate-related datasets;
designing and conducting independent research projects that leverage AI technologies to gain insights into climate systems;
participation in research projects, by collaborating with interdisciplinary teams of climate scientists, economists, data scientists, and domain experts
publishing research findings in peer-reviewed scientific journals and presenting at international conferences;
contributing to the development of new models and innovative AI approaches for climate change research


The job location is Milan, Italy.

Requirements

We are looking for a motivated person with the following requirements:


Master of Science (MSc) in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or equivalent
2-3 years of research experience in machine learning, AI, or related fields
Demonstrated advanced programming skills in Python
Strong interest in applying machine learning techniques to climate change research
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative, interdisciplinary team
Demonstrated expertise in designing and implementing deep learning algorithms
Proficiency with modern machine learning tools, with particular expertise in PyTorch


Desirable:


PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or equivalent
Expanded record of publications in peer-reviewed scientific literature, specifically in machine learning and/or climate change domains
Demonstrated knowledge of uncertainty quantification in mathematical models
Advanced expertise in specific deep learning methodologies, including:
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
Transformer architectures
Large Language Models (LLMs)
Deep reinforcement learning
Distinctive advantage: In-depth knowledge of foundation model design and implementation
Skills on computer vision applied to satellite data


Technical skills:


Advanced Python programming
Deep learning framework expertise (PyTorch)
Statistical analysis and machine learning techniques
Data preprocessing and feature engineering
Experience with climate/environment-related datasets
Version control (git)
Research and scientific writing


Duration, Compensation & Benefits


The appointment period will be initially 24 months, renewable for two additional years pending a positive evaluation. Tenure can be granted from 2 to 4 years after being appointed as a junior researcher.
The gross salary will be based on qualifications and working experience and competitive with major research centers in Europe
CMCC provides some additional benefits like welfare package, flexible working time, support during the immigration process, if needed


PROTECTED CATEGORY

Belonging to legally protected categories (ex L. 68/99) will constitute a preferential condition.

Some fiscal benefits could be applied for repatriated workers or foreign researchers/professors, having the requirements defined by Dlgs 147/2015 (for repatriates) or Dl 78/2010 (for foreigners).

CMCC is an equal-opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status, and other legally protected characteristics. Please omit from your CV any data you or we might consider discriminatory.

This job announcement is an invitation to express interest in the above-mentioned CMCC Position.

Applicants responding to this posting declare that they have read, understood and agreed to the “Official Rule for the CMCC Personnel recruitment".

We will keep your information on file for up to 1 year.

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Freelance Data Scientist (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are seeking an experienced Freelance Data Scientist to support our financial analytics and machine learning initiatives in Brussels. This is a 12-month contract with the potential for extension. The ideal candidate will apply data science, AI, and predictive modeling to enhance financial decision-making, risk assessment, and customer insights.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement machine learning models for financial forecasting, risk analysis, and fraud detection.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on large financial datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Work with structured and unstructured data from multiple sources, ensuring quality and consistency.
Build and optimize predictive models, including time-series forecasting, credit scoring, and anomaly detection.
Automate data pipelines and improve data workflows for real-time analytics.
Collaborate with finance, risk, compliance, and IT teams to align data science initiatives with business goals.
Create clear visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data privacy, security, and compliance with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or R for data science and machine learning.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of financial statistics, risk modeling, and time-series analysis.
Hands-on experience with SQL and relational databases.
Knowledge of Big Data technologies (Spark, Hadoop) and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus.
Familiarity with MLOps practices for deploying and monitoring ML models.

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Ability to communicate complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated and able to work independently and in cross-functional teams.
Attention to detail, especially regarding financial data accuracy.

Preferred Experience

Previous experience in the financial sector (banking, insurance, fintech).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Experience in credit risk modeling, fraud detection, and algorithmic trading.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or email me directly at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
🚀 Join Movify – Where elevation starts with a vision!




At Movify, we don’t just adapt to change; we drive it. As a consultancy company in Belgium, we specialize in designing, building, and scaling digital experiences that make a meaningful impact. Ready to shape the future of digital experiences?




About the job




🤠 What you'll be doing

Design and implement machine learning models to solve complex business problems
Develop data pipelines and workflows for large-scale data processing
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns and insights
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business challenges and define data science objectives
Create and maintain predictive models, optimization algorithms, and statistical analyses
Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and reports
Stay current with advancements in machine learning and data science methodologies
Test, validate, and fine-tune models for accuracy and scalability
Work closely with data engineers to ensure data integrity and availability
Contribute to the development of the company’s data strategy and best practices




🤓 Skills & qualifications

3+ years of experience in a data science or related role
Proficiency in Python or R, with a strong understanding of data manipulation libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy)
Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with large datasets
Solid understanding of statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, and probability
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A proactive and innovative mindset with attention to detail
Fluent in French or Dutch with good command of English
A passion for turning data into actionable insights




😍 Movify offers

Cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and business
Continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and workshops
A dynamic and agile environment that fosters creativity and innovation
A team of passionate experts who thrive on collaboration
Flexible working conditions with a strong emphasis on work-life balance
Competitive compensation with performance-based incentives
State-of-the-art tools, resources, and facilities
A supportive and inclusive culture that values every voice
Regular team-building activities and celebrations to keep the energy high

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

Title: Data Scientist - AI/NLP/ML
HTML:
CV Submission deadline: 25th March

Location: Anywhere in Belgium

Only EU citizens or candidate's with Work Permit (valid for the next 2 years) in Belgium


VASS is actively seeking a Data Scientist - AI/NLP/ML to work for our client, the European Commission in Belgium.


DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS


The tasks include:


• Design and implementation of AI solutions at REGIO in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead;

• Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;

• Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;

• Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions;

• Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management.


KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS


• Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP; Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques;

• Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;

• Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud);

• Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI;

• Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models;

• Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset;

• Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow);

• Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;

• Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail;

• Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments;

• Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.


SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:


• Minimum 3 years experience and expertise in the command of Python and R proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.

• Minimum 1 year experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing.

• Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal);

• Outstanding communication skills and ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences;

• Excellent command of English. Good command of French;


If you are interested, please don't hesitate to submit your application!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Brussels - Freelance




We are looking for a Data scientist to support FME data flows related to asset management. The role involves processing, analyzing, and managing large datasets using FME software and SQL. The candidate will work in a small team, collaborating closely to develop and implement data solutions. The data comes from various applications and is ultimately stored in a SQL Server environment.




Experience required:

Experience working in an Agile team
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python
Basic knowledge of GIS (Geographic Information Systems)
Experience in optimizing/tuning databases and queries
Experience with FME
Experience in analyzing data flows
Experience with SQL Server
Experience in data analysis
Proficiency in Dutch at CEFR level C2
Experience with databases (SQL, Oracle)
Experience with scripting (Shell, Perl, Python)

Working Arrangement:




12 month B2B contract freelance

Hybrid working

Day rate

Title: Data Science Internship
HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously? Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science & Analytics group in the industry, developing sophisticated mathematical models and algorithms and applying Operations Research techniques?

Then join P&G as a Data Science intern for Supply Chain! Through your internship, you will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and learn how to work across domains and functions to make P&G’s supply chain more performant, more resilient and more sustainable.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE.

AS A DATA SCIENCE FOR SUPPLY CHAIN INTERN, YOU WILL:

  • Influence decisions from daily through to strategic ones, made across functions, at all levels of leadership, to have a meaningful impact on the performance, resiliency and environmental footprint of one of the largest CPG companies in the world;
  • Build the next generation of supply chain analytics, using:
    • Mathematical modeling techniques: decision analysis, optimization, machine learning, simulation etc.;
    • Programming languages (at least one of these): Python, SQL, R, Hive/Impala, MATLAB, etc.;
    • Data Visualization: Power BI, Tableau, etc.
    • Work with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytical solutions;
    • Communicate insights from complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive;
    • Belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

    Job Qualifications

    YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU:

    • Are currently pursuing a Master's degree in a quantitative field (Engineering, Statistics, Operation Research, Decisions Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics, Data Science, etc.);
    • Have strong analytical skills and proficiency in at least one programming language (R, Python, SQL, etc.) or family of techniques (optimization, simulation, machine learning, predictive modeling, etc.);
    • Are adaptable and able to handle multiple priorities effectively, both independently and as part of a collaborative team;
    • Are proficient in English, both written and spoken;

    We are offering internships of at least 3 months throughout the year.

    If studying at a Belgian university, please make sure you consult with the internship department at your school to agree on the paid internship we offer.

    Your Advantages

    • A temporary contract for the duration of your internship, with an attractive compensation package;
    • Monthly allowance: 2319,5 EUR brut/month, prorated 13th month based on the months worked during your internship period;
    • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
    • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
    • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues;

    • Subsidized company restaurant;

    • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
    • Flexibility in terms of working hours;
    • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?

In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.

As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.

Responsibilities

Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository


Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standards.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.


Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions


Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.


Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence


Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.


Education


Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.


Professional Experience


Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Technical Skills


Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.


Languages


Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Scientist

Duration: Until the end of September 2025 (With the possibility of being extended)

Position Type: Freelance/Contract/B2B




Responsibilities:




Develop and maintain machine learning models, including but not limited to, predictive models, natural language processing models, and computer vision models.
Analyze large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning solutions.

Background working closely with Snowflake

Excellent analytical skills and profound expertise in the application of statistical modeling
Demonstrate excellent programming skills in Python & SQL as well as good skills in related analytical libraries.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
As an Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).

Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment

Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLM’s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLM’s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...) is an asset;
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.

Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am currently searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to join my client in Belgium on a payroll basis.




The ideal candidate will have knowledge of Python, Machine Learning and Java (Spring Boot).




**This position is also open to fully remote candidates based in the CET time-zone**




Your Role:

Architect and Develop ML Integration: Design and implement the software architecture for machine learning integration within the product.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with stakeholders (product owners, data scientists, architects, front-end engineers) to align user requirements and standards with technical specifications and integration strategies.
Back-End Oversight: Lead the design and review of back-end systems, including data access layers, ensuring seamless functionality and scalability.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on emerging tech (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Azure ML) to refine back-end architecture and enhance ML integration capabilities.







Required Skills:

Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Technical Expertise:
Strong experience in software architecture and engineering.
Skilled in Python and Java (Spring Boot).
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and OOP.
Proficient in machine learning concepts and tools.
Solid knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and RESTful API design.
Work Environment: Agile/Scrum experience with a collaborative mindset.
Communication: Clear articulation of technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




The Offer:

What We Offer:

Exciting Opportunities: Be part of a dynamic, fast-growing company in the industrial analytics space, working with a global team of experts in data science, software engineering, and industrial automation.
Competitive Benefits: Attractive salary, benefits package, and a company car or mobility budget.
Top-Tier Equipment: Developer laptop (MacBook Pro).
Flexibility: Work remotely up to 60% or fully remote if outside Belgium, with flexible working hours and a strong focus on work/life balance.
Prime Location: Access to a modern office at the Corda Campus in Hasselt.
Career Growth: Expand your skills and advance your career in a fast-expanding company with state-of-the-art tools and a visionary approach.
Supportive Environment: Collaborative, open-minded culture that encourages personal and professional development.
Learning Opportunities: Personal learning and development budget, company-managed, and external training opportunities.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a Machine Learning Engineer to join our AI Development team, responsible for delivering cutting-edge AI models to optimise operations and performance. This role involves close collaboration with engineers and cross-functional teams to develop, implement, and maintain AI applications.




Key Responsibilities:




Develop, train, and validate AI models to solve complex technical challenges.

Implement and optimize machine learning frameworks for diverse applications.

Conduct experiments to evaluate and enhance AI algorithms.

Oversee tools for AI model lifecycle management and integration.

Perform data analysis and preprocessing to improve model performance.

Work with teams to deploy and integrate AI solutions effectively.




What We’re Looking For:




Strong passion for AI and machine learning in a high-performance environment.

Excellent teamwork and communication skills.

Master’s or PhD in engineering, mathematics, physics, data science, or a related field.

Expertise in statistics, data science, linear algebra, and machine learning algorithms.

Proficiency in Python and relevant AI/ML libraries.

Practical experience with software development methodologies.




Location: Brussels

Length of Contract: 12 Months

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
HTML:
Please carefully read the job description before applying. Only shortlisted candidates who meet the requirements will be contacted.


DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS:

AI solution analysis, design and implementation in close coordination with team management and AI technical lead;

Propose adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets;

Deliver AI and ML training to technical and non-technical (business) users ;

Communicate project results in a clear, modern and easy to understand manner geared towards business (non-IT) users;

Data modelling in the context of data science and AI;

Creation of industrial solutions to exploit data science and AI solutions;

Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management;

Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyse business requirements and translate them into AI solutions;

Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management upon request.

Required skills:

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP; Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques;
  • Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks;
  • Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is an advantage;
  • Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI;
  • Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI and Machine Learning (statistical) models;
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset;
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g. Data Services, Talend etc);
  • Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation;
  • Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail;
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments;
  • Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.



Delivery mode: Near-site (Brussels)

Deadline: 17/03/2025 at 11:30 AM (CET)

Title: [Full Remote] Junior Data Scientist & AI (€50k-€80k)
Description:
Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,000,000 users come true!




We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals who aspire to join our team around Europe. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a role in this area becomes available and your CV matches the profile we are seeking.




For all Junior positions in the Tech Field, we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k) in the EMEA Region, you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.




We are looking only for Junior profiles, with 0 to 3 years of experience.

--




Responsibilities:

Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:

Implementation of Machine Learning Algorithms: You will have the opportunity to implement and test machine learning algorithms, contributing to the development of intelligent solutions for business challenges. Specifically, working alongside our tech team, you will be involved in Joinrs AI: our Artificial Intelligence model that assists our community in finding employment.
Data Analysis and Modeling: You will participate in data analysis, developing predictive models and contributing to provide meaningful insights to enhance business decisions.
Data Visualization: You will learn to create clear and informative data visualizations to effectively communicate complex results to various stakeholders. In particular, you will create interactive dashboards to showcase data and Key Performance Indicators (Data Visualization) to the team, clients, investors, and all key stakeholders.
Optimization of Business Processes: You will collaborate in identifying and optimizing business processes through the application of data-driven solutions.
Participation in Technological Brainstorming Sessions: You will be involved in brainstorming sessions to generate innovative ideas and contribute to identifying new opportunities in the field of Artificial Intelligence.
Continuous Training and Updates on the Latest Trends: You will have access to continuous training programs to stay updated on the latest trends and advancements in the fields of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.




--




What We Offer:

Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:

Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.
Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.
Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.
Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.
Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.
Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.
Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.

--




Who We Are:

Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.




We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.




Our community includes over 1,000,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!

--




Contract & Compensation:

For all Junior positions we offer a full remote contract (Annual Salary: €50k-€80k).




Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.

--




Selection Process:

CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).

Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.

Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.

--




Why Join Our Team?

Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.

Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.

Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
ALTEN Belgium is a leading player in the fields of Engineering, Life Sciences and Information Technology, where people and innovation are at the heart of everything we do. In our open and dynamic organization, we empower our ambitious employees to unlock their full potential and thrive professionally.




We achieve this by offering them exciting projects and continuous development opportunities through the ALTEN Academy and our knowledge-sharing events. Our employees are part of a vast network of expertise, extending even internationally. This way, we foster individual growth while delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients.




Context

In this role, you’ll help lead innovation in machine-learning techniques for driving and vehicle monitoring. You’ll be responsible for creating a machine-learning model that monitors and analyses time series data in real-time. As part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team, you'll collaborate with researchers and engineers to integrate and optimize the model. If you’re a collaborative problem-solver with a strong background in time series and deep learning, and you're passionate about motorsport and automotive technology, this is the perfect opportunity for you to make an impact.




Expertise

Expertise in Machine Learning and Deep Learning, including familiarity with classical algorithms
Knowledge of foundation models, including large vision models and multi-modal models
Experience with time series analysis (experience with large real-time data is a plus)
(Preferred) Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and deploying deep neural networks in practical applications
(Preferred) Experience in integrating algorithms and conducting testing in real-world settings (e.g., embedded devices and cloud infrastructure)




Technical

Proficient in Python, with additional knowledge of C++ and MATLAB/Simulink
Strong expertise in PyTorch (experience with PyTorch Forecasting and TensorRT is a plus)
Familiarity with Python libraries such as Pandas and Scikit-learn (experience with SKTime and Darts is a bonus)
Skilled in Linux, Docker, and Git
Experienced in working with Linux environments and High-Performance Computing (HPC), preferably with AWS and Azure
(Optional) Experience with embedded architecture, specifically Nvidia Jetson




Tasks

Design, assess, and refine algorithms from the time series literature
Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in foundation models and time series analysis
Implement algorithms and manage the code repository
Work closely with researchers and engineers to train, test, and evaluate the model
Develop and support demonstrations with real systems and prepare for field tests
Present findings during regular project meetings and prepare results for publication




If you are interested, don't hesitate to apply!




Note: We are only hiring candidates authorized to work in Belgium without needing visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Akkodis is looking for a skilled Data Scientist for a prominent client in the automotive industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to develop and deploy data analytics solutions across business units at a pan-European level.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyze and preprocess large datasets using Python and SQL to derive actionable insights.
Develop and deploy predictive models, recommendation systems, anomaly detection algorithms, and optimization scripts.
Validate and interpret results using statistical methodologies.
Visualize data and effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.




Qualifications:




Master’s degree in Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Statistics (Computer Science degree is a plus).
3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist, with expertise in machine learning, optimization, time series forecasting, and recommender systems.
Proficient in Python and SQL; experience with the Dataiku DSS platform is a must (required certifications).
Familiarity with the Snowflake cloud data warehouse platform.
Strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and excellent communication skills.




Traits We Value:




Intellectual curiosity and a creative approach to problem-solving.
Ability to summarize progress visually and communicate complex concepts simply.
A proactive team player who can adapt to new ways of working.

  • 3+ years of professional experience as a Data Scientist, with expertise in machine learning, optimization, time series forecasting, and recommender systems.
  • Proficient in Python and SQL; experience with the Dataiku DSS platform is a must (required certifications).
  • Familiarity with the Snowflake cloud data warehouse platform.
  • Strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and excellent communication skills.


Traits We Value:


  • Intellectual curiosity and a creative approach to problem-solving.
  • Ability to summarize progress visually and communicate complex concepts simply.
  • A proactive team player who can adapt to new ways of working.

Title: Data Scientist (SN0604)
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist to tackle real-world challenges using Data Science, Machine Learning, and Statistical Techniques.


The ideal candidate will develop scalable data solutions, build end-to-end machine learning pipelines, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.


Key Responsibilities


Apply statistical methods and machine learning techniques to solve real-world business problems.
Develop and deploy data-driven solutions for both internal and external stakeholders.
Design, build, and maintain structured and unstructured datasets.
Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering.
Implement feature extraction techniques to improve model performance.
Develop end-to-end data & machine learning pipelines for production environments.
Conduct reproducible research and stay updated with the latest advancements in AI, NLP, and data science.
Implement and optimize machine learning algorithms for different domains.
Ensure best practices in software engineering and code quality for research implementation.
Work closely with Engineering, Operations, and Product Management to integrate AI solutions into business processes.
Develop production-ready AI models that enhance operational efficiency and business insights.


Required Skills & Qualifications


Python, including Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn.
SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
data pipelining and feature engineering.
Ability to apply statistical methods to data analysis.
Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to work independently.


Experience & Education


Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience in developing AI solutions across various domains.
Background in data engineering and backend development in production environments (3+ years).
Experience in machine learning, text processing, NLP, and information retrieval (2+ years).

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities -

You design, develop, and deploy robust machine learning models that address the unique challenges of power generation.
These models are used to predict equipment failures, optimize maintenance schedules, enhance energy output, and more.
You champion MLOps best practices to ensure the long-term sustainability and maintainability of data products.
You implement robust monitoring, testing, and deployment pipelines.
You work closely with domain experts, engineers, and operators to understand their needs, gather feedback, and deliver solutions that make a meaningful impact on their day-to-day work.
You collaborate closely with the IT NEO Data Platform team, leveraging their shared Python packages and workflows to standardize the building and running of ML use cases.
You stay abreast of the latest advancements in machine learning and explore emerging technologies, such as multi-agent reinforcement learning, to identify new opportunities for optimization.




Required Skills




You have a natural understanding and strong interest in the energy domain, with a desire to delve into the complexities of electricity production and its unique challenges.
You bring over 4 years of proven experience in industrializing machine learning products, from concept to production.
You are fluent in English and Dutch/French, allowing for effective collaboration and communication in multilingual environments.
You are proficient with AWS cloud services, including S3, Glue, Athena, and Sagemaker.
You have demonstrated expertise in Python development, specifically for data science and machine learning.
You possess broad knowledge of machine learning frameworks, such as Scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyOD, and Darts, enabling effective implementation of diverse ML solutions.
You have strong DevOps experience, including Git, CI/CD pipelines, and Docker containers, ensuring smooth deployment and maintenance of data-driven solutions.
Having experience building multi-agent Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems is a plus.
Bringing demonstrated experience working in industrial environments, preferably within the utility sector is a benefit.
Possessing expertise in time series anomaly detection techniques is a valued addition.
Experience working with historians, such as Aveva OSIsoft PI is an asset.




Preferred Skills

Experience working with historians, such as Aveva OSIsoft PI is an asset.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As a collaborator in the Machine Learning team, you ensure the different predictive models and algorithms are running qualitatively and on time in the production environment also called the model factory. The mission of the machine learning engineer is key because this role makes the bridge between the products delivered by the Data Science team and the usage of the business.




The machine learning engineer will also cover some more technical missions as for example web scraping, POC’s concerning AI & Generative AI (in order to ensure a move to production for those POC’s).




The Machine Learning team is responsible for the quality of the models and as a consequence of the value created by the models that will be used by all the internal clients.




Your responsibilities:

Deploy large scale machine learning models and other scripts into production environment (in cloud and on-premise environments)
Review, optimize and simplify the code to ensure quality and reusability
Monitor the quality of input variables and the performances of the models’ outputs.
Contribute to parts of the ML pipeline, such as data preprocessing, feature selection, and model evaluation.
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate models into production.
Monitor model performance and updates models as needed
Solve well-defined machine learning problems and may work on smaller projects or parts of larger projects.
Apply existing algorithms and techniques to specific business problems




Specific expertise:

Expert understanding of git, experience with CI/CD pipelines;
Proficiency at Python and solid knowledge of at least one deep learning framework such as TensorFlow / Keras or PyTorch is a must.
Good knowledge of computational infrastructure;
Basic knowledge of Terraform;
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, general deep learning, predictive modelling and Generative AI in order to be able to challenge the inputs and the outputs produced by the Data Science team
Understanding of Google Cloud Platform, ML Ops principles and software development tools/best practices;
Expertise in Data Ingestion / Processing and Modelling: you are able to express complex data needs and understand data quality-cleansing processes & methods
Extensive Corporate Data Knowledge: aware of critical company business processes and underlying data, you are able to challenge data quality
Fluency in SQL for writing efficient queries on large datasets
Good knowledge of Linux operating system
Ability to write robust code in Python, R and Java
Good to have: good knowledge of networking, multiprocessing, parallel computing and real-time computations;
Should be able to challenge the inputs and outputs of AI and Gen AI products as well as the way it was built.




Your profile:

Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics) or equivalent work experience. with 2-5 years of experience in machine learning or related fields
Proficient in key machine learning tools and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn)
Analytical thinking and self-learning spirit
Strong programming and data analytics skills
Able to work and collaborate transversally
Good communication and presentation skills (vulgarisation)
Collaboration skills (with other data scientists, data engineers and other teams)
Capacity to influence and engage, assertiveness and being diplomatic
Customer-oriented and pragmatic
Stress resistant
Fluent English and fluent French or Dutch




Our offer:

You will make the difference in this highly innovative vibe. As a result, you will develop your full potential by working with highly skilled colleagues and through continuous training. Moreover, you can count on a highly competitive and versatile compensation (market competitive salary, company car or legal mobility budget, homeworking and net allowance, performance bonus, meal vouchers) and benefits package.




Inspired? Please send us your resume and we will rapidly get back to you to invite you for further interviews.

Show more
