Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization’s cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.


, ING Bank

Title: Research Scientist (Jr)
Description:
Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium




Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.




Your Responsibilities

Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.




Required Skills

Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).




Soft Skills

Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.




Application Requirements

CV highlighting:
Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) –note: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

Title: ⚙️ Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you’ll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!

Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.

The Job

If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!

As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.

At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.

We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.

What You'll Find At Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].

What We’re Looking For


You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You’re familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
Programming in Python and SQL is something you’re very comfortable with.
Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You’ve been in contact with at least one.
You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you’re aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn’t scare you.
You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,…)
You speak Dutch & English fluently, knowledge of French is a plus.


This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us

The Offer


An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...
Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
Opportunities for individual training and team learning.
Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.

Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots!
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you’ll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!

Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.

 The Job

If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!

As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.

At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.

We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.

What You'll Find At Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].

What We’re Looking For

  • You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
  • Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
  • You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
  • GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You’re familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
  • Programming in Python and SQL is something you’re very comfortable with.
  • Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You’ve been in contact with at least one.
  • You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
  • CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you’re aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
  • Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn’t scare you.
  • You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
  • Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
  • A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,…)
  • You speak Dutch & English fluently, knowledge of French is a plus.

This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us

The Offer

  • An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:
    • Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
    • Hospitalization and group insurance
    • High-end laptop
    • Smartphone with subscription
    • Substantial amount of holidays
    • Meal vouchers
    • ...
  • Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.
  • Opportunities for individual training and team learning.
  • Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.
Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.

Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots!

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
N-SIDE Careers Junior Data Scientist

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Energy department based in Louvain-la-Neuve.

Who We Are

N-SIDE is a world leader in increasing the efficiency of life sciences and energy industries by providing software and services that optimize the use of natural resources, facilitating the transition to a more sustainable world.

To achieve this, N-SIDE leverages its deep industry knowledge, technical expertise, and understanding of applied mathematics to help global pharmaceutical and energy companies anticipate, adapt, and optimize their decisions.

In the energy industry, N-SIDE helps electricity market and grid operators in enabling a safer and faster transition toward renewable sources.

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be part of our Energy team. You will deliver machine learning-based software solutions and consultancy services. You will contribute to innovative and challenging advanced analytics projects for various European Transmission System operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, helping the different actors better address the complex challenges of the energy transition.

What You’ll Do


You will provide hands-on contributions to analytical projects for various European Transmission System Operators, power exchanges, and possibly market participants, as part of our internal projects teams of power market experts and energy data scientists
You will develop AI-based Python prototypes, maintain and improve production code, perform data engineering tasks (e.g. extract, transform, load), run simulations, analyze results, and extract key findings. While most projects will have a strong data science focus, you may also be exposed to other analytical techniques (e.g. optimization, power flow simulations) depending on business needs and priorities.
You will communicate insights effectively by preparing reports, slides, and presentations for our customers that translate complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations.
You will engage with customers to understand their needs, gather feedback, and propose improvements and ideas while explaining advanced analytics concepts in a clear, and business-oriented manner.
You will contribute to the maintenance, support, and continuous improvement of our in-house forecasting solution based on Machine Learning
You will support clients in their use of our Energy applications. This will constitute a minor portion of your responsibilities, yet may occasionally (one weekend every five weeks) require completion outside of regular business hours (with additional compensation and/or benefits provided).


About You


You hold a Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Energy Economics, or a related field, with a strong focus on Data Science.
You are a young graduate or have a maximum of 1-2 years years of experience
You have a solid foundation in machine learning and artificial intelligence, with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for the field
You are proficient in Python and can efficiently develop prototypes to perform data-driven analyses.
You can effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, demonstrating a customer-focused approach and a genuine enthusiasm for assisting users.
You possess strong written and verbal communication skills and can clearly articulate insights and findings.
You are customer-oriented, results-driven, and have a problem-solving mindset
You are curious, proactive, and a strong team player, eager to collaborate and continuously learn.
You are interested in expanding your knowledge of the energy sector, particularly in electricity markets and power system operations. While prior experience in the field is a plus, it is not required.
You have fully professional proficiency in English


Travel: 0%

Start date: ASAP

Our offer

At N-SIDE, we develop leaders. What’s important for us is that you grow and learn, because we care about you, which is N-SIDE’s hallmark.You will be part of a fun and flexible work environment in which creativity, freedom and initiative are rewarded.

You will join a diverse team of over 200 passionate engineers, computer scientists, and business experts from 30+ different nationalities, with 25% holding PhDs. Together, we are committed to making a meaningful impact toward a more sustainable future.

N-SIDE offers a great compensation package, which includes a company car and full range of benefits which can be personalised thanks to our Flex Income Plan.

At N-SIDE we value diversity. All candidates will be treated equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, disability, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law. N-SIDE will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

We are headquartered in Belgium with offices in the USA and Japan. The company is certified B Corporation, Best Managed Company by Deloitte Belgium, ISO 14001 and ISO 27001.

Motivated to join our team and bring N-SIDE to the next level?

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

We are committed to respecting your privacy and protecting your personal data, including any information which allows us to identify you as an individual person. N-SIDE uses the applicant’s personal data in a fair and lawful manner. N-SIDE collects and processes personal data in accordance with the privacy statement available in the privacy policy. Personal information (applicant data) submitted by an applicant will only be used by N-SIDE to ensure an effective recruitment process and will be used for recruitment purposes only.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Company: Better Placed Ltd - A Sunday Times Top 10 Employer!
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

Up to €75,000

Remote – UK or EU based







I'm working with an AI start up that specialises in integrating AI into manufacturing processes. This is an industry ripe for tech innovation and their AI product is adding some real value with several large companies already using it




You'll be working on getting their AI product perfected and getting stuck into their LLMs and ML systems. This role is a blend of Machine Learning and Data Science with the chance to work with an experienced team of engineers.




This is a global team distributed around the world who are really making an impact in their niche utilization of AI.




What you’ll do:




• Develop and optimize RAG pipelines to enhance LLM-driven troubleshooting.




• Work with PyVector to store and retrieve relevant data efficiently.




• Implement vector embedding models to power retrieval and improve accuracy.




• Deploy and scale models on AWS




• Fine-tune and evaluate LLMs for task-specific reasoning andaccuracy.




• Learn and progress your career in an established team of global experts




What you’ll need:




• 1- 3 years commercial experience, mid-level or junior looking to step up




• A Bachelors or Masters from a top University.




• Solid Python development skills, with experience in machine learning




• Experience with RAG architectures and knowledge retrieval techniques.




• Familiarity with PyVector for vector search and retrieval.




• Experience using vectorembedding models




• Experience working with AWS for cloud-based ML deployment.




• Knowledge of LangChain, LlamaIndex, or other RAG frameworks.




The key to the role would be RAG and cloud deployment experience!




If you’re looking to work for a unique AI start up that is disrupting a typically antiquated industry with a cutting edge product then apply with your CV or reach out directly to Ben Greensmith.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about AI, machine learning, and energy innovation? We’re looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join a cutting-edge Generation Data Intelligence Team and drive real impact in power generation and optimization.




Why Join?

🔹 Design & deploy ML models for predictive maintenance, fault detection, and energy optimization.

🔹 Champion MLOps best practices, ensuring scalable and sustainable AI solutions.

🔹 Collaborate with engineers, operators, and IT teams to shape the future of smart energy.

🔹 Work with AWS, Python, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyOD, and more.

🔹 Explore cutting-edge multi-agent reinforcement learning & RAG systems.




What You Bring

✅ 4+ years of ML product industrialization experience.

✅ Expertise in Python & ML frameworks (Scikit-learn, XGBoost, etc.).

✅ Strong knowledge of AWS cloud services (S3, Glue, Athena, SageMaker).

✅ DevOps experience (Git, CI/CD, Docker).

✅ Fluent in English + Dutch/French.




💡 Bonus: Experience in time-series anomaly detection, industrial environments, or historian systems (OSIsoft PI).

Title: Data Scientist _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.

En tant que Data Scientist:


Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.


Un job fait pour vous ?


Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.


Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:


Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.


Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.

En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.

What’s next ?


Vous postulez sur notre jobsite
Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !


Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq: 50260

Sur le contenu de la fonction

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@sncb.be

Sur la procédure de sélection :

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@sncb.be

+32 499 06 55 75

  • Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
  • Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
  • Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
  • Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Freelance AI Engineer (Financial Sector) – Brussels (Hybrid, 12 Months)

Overview

We are looking for a skilled Freelance AI Engineer to work closely with our data team and drive AI-powered innovations in the financial sector. Based in Brussels, this 12-month contract involves collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI models for fraud detection, risk assessment, and automated financial decision-making.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data team (data scientists, data analysts, and data engineers) to build and deploy AI-driven financial solutions.
Design, develop, and implement machine learning and deep learning models for risk management, fraud detection, algorithmic trading, and credit scoring.
Optimize AI models for real-time financial applications while ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Work with big data platforms to process large-scale structured and unstructured financial datasets.
Develop and maintain end-to-end AI pipelines, including data ingestion, model training, and deployment.
Deploy AI models using MLOps best practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, and retraining).
Ensure AI solutions comply with financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II).
Work with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for scalable AI deployment.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve financial analytics and decision-making.




Required Skills & Qualifications

Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in Python or C++ for AI/ML development.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Hands-on experience in AI model deployment using Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines.
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases for working with financial data.
Familiarity with big data processing technologies (Apache Spark, Hadoop) is a plus.
Experience in cloud computing (AWS SageMaker, Google Vertex AI, Azure ML).
Solid understanding of MLOps tools (MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow).

Soft Skills

Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset.
Ability to collaborate effectively with data scientists, analysts, and engineers.
Excellent communication skills to explain AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented, with a focus on model accuracy and ethical AI considerations.

Preferred Experience

Prior experience in the financial sector (banking, fintech, insurance).
Knowledge of financial regulations (Basel III, IFRS, MiFID II) as they relate to AI.
Experience with high-frequency trading (HFT), robo-advisors, or automated financial systems is a plus.




Contract Details

Location: Brussels (Hybrid – On-site & Remote)
Duration: 12 months (with possibility of extension)
Type: Freelance Contract
Start Date: ASAP
Compensation: Competitive, based on experience




If you are interested, feel free to apply with your CV or directly email me at adam@kodastaff.com

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
B.E.S. (Business & Engineering Solutions) is growing and thus welcoming new AI Research Engineer in our Automotive team.




As a AI Research Engineer at B.E.S., you will enjoy a collaborative environment where you will work closely with others in an organisation focused on innovation.




Your responsibilities:




Develop and optimize machine learning algorithms for time series data.
Stay updated on advancements in foundation models and time series analysis.
Implement, test, and maintain machine learning models and code repositories.
Collaborate with researchers and engineers in the automotive sector for model training and evaluation.
Support field tests and demonstrations with actual systems.
Integrate algorithms into embedded devices and cloud infrastructures.
Contribute to deployment and continuous integration of models in real-world environments.
Travel for collaborative work and testing between locations.




Your profile:




You have a background in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or Mathematics.
You have 3-5 years of relevant professional experience.
You have a research-driven mindset, with at least a Master’s degree (PhD preferred).
You are practical and you have a hands-on approach focused on solving real-world challenges.
You are a highly self-motivated, and skilled at juggling multiple tasks with ease. You are always eager to learn and grow.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills,
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge,
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances, OR a freelance contract,
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team!

Title: Expert in AI/ NLP/ ML (SNS01378)
Description:
Job Description

Responsibility


Design and implementation of AI solutions at REGIO in close collaboration with team management and AI technical lead.
Propose or support adequate machine learning models and employ NLP techniques to extract valuable insights from large datasets.
Support the development of generative AI solutions in knowledge management.
Engage with colleagues from various teams, analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions.
Follow AI developments within the European Commission. Attend meetings on AI and prepare briefings for the management.


LEVEL OF EDUCATION


DIGIT-TM II Service requirements, a minimum educational qualification
for lot XX is: Level of education corresponding to Level 7 of the European Qualification Framework which typically corresponds to a master degree of 5 years.


Knowledge And Skills


Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP. Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks.
Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI.
Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models.
Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow).
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail.
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments.
Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.
Ability to understand, speak and write in English. French will be an advantage.


SPECIFIC EXPERTISE


Minimum 3 years experience and expertise in the command of Python and R proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.
Minimum 1 year experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic
representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing.
Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal).
Outstanding communication skills and ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences.
Excellent command of English. Good command of French

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (SN0626)
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to develop and optimize Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines to enhance LLM-driven troubleshooting. The ideal candidate will have experience with vector search, cloud deployment on AWS, and machine learning frameworks.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and optimize RAG pipelines for efficient knowledge retrieval in LLM applications.
Work with PyVector to store and retrieve relevant data effectively.
Implement vector embedding models to enhance retrieval accuracy.
Deploy and scale ML models on AWS for cloud-based applications.
Fine-tune and evaluate LLMs for improved task-specific reasoning and accuracy.
Collaborate with a team of global experts to drive innovation in LLM-powered solutions.


Required Skills & Qualifications


1-3 years of industry experience in machine learning and cloud-based ML deployment.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree from a top university in Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI, or a related field.
Python development skills
RAG architectures
retrieval techniques
PyVector for vector search and retrieval
vector embedding models
AWS cloud services for ML deployment
LangChain, LlamaIndex, or other RAG frameworks.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer – AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ years’ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you’ll definitely be interested in our training program for young graduates!

Please note that candidates hired for this position will start on Monday, the 1st of September 2025.




🤖 The Job

If you're excited about data, enjoy exploring new ideas, and want to create machine learning models that make a real difference, you'll fit right in!

As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll use your expertise to deliver tailored, high-quality AI solutions from start to finish.




At Dataroots, we combine our consulting approach with strong technical skills to build machine learning models that help businesses improve how they operate. As a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll join our team of specialists (including Data Engineers, Cloud Architects, and Data Strategists) working together to design, build, and implement data-powered solutions for our clients.




We also encourage learning and growth! You'll have chances to learn from and mentor other teammates, share what you know, and keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends through our internal training and development programs.




🎉 What you'll find at Dataroots

Since 2016, Dataroots has been committing its excellent consulting services to help clients excel in their data-driven operations. Our approach focuses on team well-being, fostering diversity, and promoting knowledge sharing. By focusing on these values, we've achieved healthy and sustainable growth over the years. Through our services, we actively encourage professional growth by exposing our employees to different industries, tools, technologies,... broadening their scope in the process.

As part of the Talan Group, we are able to take this approach to the next level, adding the element of international mobility to our employees’ career journey.

Join a team where your work will have a direct impact on both our clients and our journey. Learn more about our DNA at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




💼 What we’re looking for

You're strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
Solving problems is what drives you, and you understand Machine Learning is a means to achieve this, not the end itself.
You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
GenAI is more than a vague news term to you. You’re familiar with the concept on a more than superficial level.
Programming in Python and SQL is something you’re very comfortable with.
Cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure are not entirely new to you. You’ve been in contact with at least one.
You have heard of tools like Apache Spark and Databricks and understand their use in the data landscape.
CI/CD or MLOps aren't Star Wars characters and you’re aware of this. You are interested in learning about data architecture and infrastructure.
Picking up on new technologies and frameworks comes naturally to you and doesn’t scare you.
You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
Helping clients in overcoming their challenges energizes you. You have strong communication skills and like putting them to use.
A first practical experience is considered a big plus (internship, personal project, first professional experience,…)
You speak Dutch & English fluently, knowledge of French is a plus.




This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us 🤝




💰 The Offer

+ An attractive salary with extralegal benefits, including:

Mobility budget or a company car with fuel/charging card
Hospitalization and group insurance
High-end laptop
Smartphone with subscription
Substantial amount of holidays
Meal vouchers
...

+ Diverse and welcoming work environment, where you’ll collaborate & unwind with colleagues from different cultures and disciplines. The organization of both fun & professional events and initiatives is actively encouraged and supported.

+ Opportunities for individual training and team learning.

+ Tons of team-building events and sports initiatives to stay connected and unwind.




📍 Where you’ll work

Our main offices are in Leuven and Ghent, with co-working spaces in Antwerp. These spaces are perfect for both focusing and unwinding with colleagues, as well as brainstorming sessions and team events. While much of your work can be performed remotely, you will also work on-site with clients.




🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Excited to shape the future of AI as a Machine Learning Engineer with us? We’re looking forward to hearing from you! Apply now and start a new chapter with Dataroots! 🎉

Show more

🎯 Ready to join Dataroots?

Title: ML Engineer - MLOps, Inference
Description:
Want to scale AI Agents through innovative ML infrastructure?




A pioneering AI company is looking for an experienced Engineer to revolutionize how their agent technology is deployed and served. While others follow conventional paths, they're creating new approaches to agent-specific serving challenges.




Short term, you'll focus on cloud deployment and performance optimization, enhancing their current infrastructure. Long term, you'll help design and build proprietary frameworks that challenge the status quo of model serving.




What You'll Do:

Architect and improve cloud-based deployment systems
Create efficient solutions for concurrent model serving
Lead the transition from Open Source and third-party tools to custom frameworks
Drive innovation in model compression and performance
Design new approaches to large-scale model deployment




You Should Have:

Advanced degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong background in MLOps or Model Inference
Experience scaling AI models in production
Python expertise and interest in systems programming
Track record of solving complex deployment challenges




Bonus Points For:

LLM model serving such as vLLM or similar
Building custom serving solutions
Knowledge of GPU optimization
Experience with large language models
Background in high-performance computing




You'll join a world-class team pushing the boundaries of what's possible with AI agents. Work remotely (EU/US East Coast) or hybrid from their London office.




This role is perfect for someone who:

Enjoys tackling unprecedented technical challenges
Thinks creatively about infrastructure problems
Values practical solutions while innovating for the future
Thrives in fast-paced, research-driven environments




Compensation is highly competitive (£125,000-£250,000 basic salary), negotiable based on experience.




Ready to help define the future of AI infrastructure? Contact Marc at Techire AI to learn more. All applications will receive a response.

Short term, you'll focus on cloud deployment and performance optimization, enhancing their current infrastructure. Long term, you'll help design and build proprietary frameworks that challenge the status quo of model serving.


What You'll Do:

  • Architect and improve cloud-based deployment systems
  • Create efficient solutions for concurrent model serving
  • Lead the transition from Open Source and third-party tools to custom frameworks
  • Drive innovation in model compression and performance
  • Design new approaches to large-scale model deployment


You Should Have:

  • Advanced degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Strong background in MLOps or Model Inference
  • Experience scaling AI models in production
  • Python expertise and interest in systems programming
  • Track record of solving complex deployment challenges


Bonus Points For:

  • LLM model serving such as vLLM or similar
  • Building custom serving solutions
  • Knowledge of GPU optimization
  • Experience with large language models
  • Background in high-performance computing


You'll join a world-class team pushing the boundaries of what's possible with AI agents. Work remotely (EU/US East Coast) or hybrid from their London office.


This role is perfect for someone who:

  • Enjoys tackling unprecedented technical challenges
  • Thinks creatively about infrastructure problems
  • Values practical solutions while innovating for the future
  • Thrives in fast-paced, research-driven environments


Compensation is highly competitive (£125,000-£250,000 basic salary), negotiable based on experience.


Ready to help define the future of AI infrastructure? Contact Marc at Techire AI to learn more. All applications will receive a response.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
My client is seeking AI/ML Engineers with expertise in computer vision and image processing. They are a heavily funded and ambitious AI start-up based in Abu Dhabi, UAE.




The ideal candidate will develop and optimize deep learning models / VLMs for object detection, segmentation, classification, text extraction, and fine-tuning for domain-specific applications.




My client is seeking top talent globally, ideally they are looking for candidates from tier 1 or equivalent companies and top education backgrounds.




You will be integral to developing industry-leading AI software driven by cutting-edge research. You will have the opportunity to design, implement, and deploy innovative software solutions in a fast-paced environment while working alongside ex tech-giant professionals from the likes of Amazon, Meta, Google DeepMind, McKinsey and Microsoft.




Alongside your tax-free salary you will be offered a region leading benefits package including:




A months salary to cover relocation costs for you and your family.
Education allowance for up to 3 children (private schooling).
Annual flight home for you + family.
Private healthcare for you + family.
Accommodation for a month on arrival.
Annual 25% bonus.




To discover more, apply now!

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Function

Advisory - Manager

Roles & Responsibilities

In a world where stakeholders are consistently expected to provide more diverse digital experiences, data scientists are continuously challenged – to work is to grow. The KPMG Lighthouse is currently looking for talents in the field of data science, people who are able to exploit data to create smart digital solutions, but who are also able to inspire about the art of the possible.

What is the job about?


Contributing to the growth of Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning as a topic and as a competence at KPMG
Contributing to the growth of our project portfolio
Mentoring colleagues
Stepping ito conversations with clients, and translating their business needs into Artificial Intelligence solutions Gathering and organizing data
Deciding on an analytical approach, and executing the analysis with a good eye for detail, all the while efficiently working towards the best possible solution
Communicating with clients: absorbing their thoughts, convincing them of the strengths of your models
Bringing your model into production – and communicating with specialist
IT profiles
Creating and maintaining good relationships with stakeholders – clients, vendors, KPMG colleagues,…


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications

The tasks of a data scientist manager are diverse, and we are not looking for the unicorn data scientist, but a mindset focused on learning on the job is vital!

Elements we hope to see in our data scientist managers:


Concrete experience delivering concrete AI products.
A master degree with strong elements of modern data science techniques: Machine Learning algorithms, coding, statistics,…
Other types of eduction are also valued.
A sound knowledge of algorithms, and the ability to critically apply this knowledge to practical problems.
Knowledge of common data science software. We have a Python-first setup, but will if needed tackle problems using R, SAS, SQL, Spark, and work with tools such as Jupyter Notebooks, IDE’s, Git, Microsoft Azure,
Obviously, additional bonus points for PhD’s, and more specific knowledge like e.g. Keras, D3.js
The desire to learn and grow
A positive, collaborative, and flexible mindset
Fluent professional proficiency in Dutch or French is required.


We offer

As a Certified Top Employer We Offer


An international corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
A competitive and attractive compensation package and a great number of extra-legal advantages (Company car + fuel card, IPhone/IPad, group & hospitalization insurance, Allowances,…) which are customizable with our Reflex@KPMG plan.
Career and business development opportunities combined with trainings based on your personal needs and ambitions.
Learning and growth opportunities designed for leaders through our Management development Track.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working from wherever you are.
A team of passionate colleagues to reach higher goals and support eachother
A buddy and performance manager to support and assist you through your first months at KPMG.
Great teambuilding, sport & wellbeing initiatives through our Together@KPMG program.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and backgrounds.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We’re seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our analytics team, driving performance optimization and providing strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing and refining LTV, ROAS prediction models, and working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data to enhance user acquisition and marketing efficiency. This is a hands-on role where you’ll also lead the development of foundational marketing analytics systems.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You'll be working on hands-on development and refinement of LTV and ROAS predictive models to optimize marketing spend.
You'll maintain and improve SKAN ETL pipelines, ensuring accurate collection and analysis of post-install metrics to inform marketing strategy .
You'll analyze marketing KPIs like CAC, CTR, ROAS, and conversion rates, delivering actionable insights to drive campaign performance.
You'll collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and data engineering teams to identify data needs and strategies .
You'll design and implement A/B tests for user acquisition campaigns, measuring impact and optimizing channels.
You'll create dashboards and reports to visualize marketing performance and trends, communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders .
You'll proactively drive the evolution of marketing analytics by identifying data-driven opportunities and building foundational analytics processes.


What You'll Bring To The Team


2-3+ years of experience in marketing data science or analytics (preferably in mobile gaming or apps).
Proficiency in SQL, Python (or R), with a strong background in building and deploying LTV/ROAS prediction models.
Experience working with SKAN and marketing attribution tools .
Strong understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC, ROAS, LTV, and engagement metrics.
Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification) for building predictive models.
Experience in A/B testing and statistical analysis.
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Familiarity with BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.
Show more

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Do you want to work in a company with the purpose of helping patients around the world? Do you want to learn and grow every day? Do you want to change healthcare?




Lyfegen is a fast-growing health-tech company making healthcare more accessible and affordable by delivering solutions for healthcare payers and pharma to identify the right drug pricing agreements, simulate and understand the financial impacts of those agreements, and automate the management of them.




We are seeking a passionate and skilled AI Engineer. This role focuses on leading and driving AI initiatives, optimizing simulations to support drug pricing negotiations, and improving our LLM-based chatbot to facilitate learning about drug reimbursements. This position offers an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team at the forefront of innovation in healthcare technology.




We are doing things nobody has done before! Thus, creative problem solving is a must and a get-things-done mentality a definitive requirement.




Your main responsibilities:

Lead all the AI initiatives inside the Lyfegen platform.
Discover and benchmark different strategies for fast and accurate RAG on tabular data sources. Evaluate methods to achieve efficient and precise question-answering.
Orchestrate and compose AI-supported toolchains. Use your knowledge of existing components, models and libraries such as LangChain and GPT to create AI toolchains to support diverse user tasks on the Lyfegen Platform.
Support Lyfegen internal users with machine learning tooling. Provide ML tools and automations to streamline and enhance our internal workflows and processes.
Work with our internal Product Owners to translate company vision into technical specs and collaborate with engineers to solve challenges.




Who you are:

Machine learning and NLP expertise:
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms such as gradient boosted trees.
Experience in multiple large language models (LLMs) specifically for Q&A and chat.
Experience in benchmarking and optimizing toolchains.
Proficiency in AI-relevant programming languages such as Python. Familiarity with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch and LangChain.
Familiarity with databases for storing and retrieving data for AI models. (SQLAlchemy,Alembic)
Expertise in Python-based Web frameworks such as Flask, Django or FastAPI.
Research mindset by owning an AI feature/product end to end building server-side software that delivers AI inference results, aiming for reliable, scalable systems that seamlessly integrate into our products.
AI toolchain integration skills. Ability to integrate and orchestrate AI tools and libraries into cohesive, user-friendly, and performant systems.
Experience in recommendation engines is a bonus, particularly in apps involving pricing.
Strong problem-solving abilities to identify issues and evaluate solutions.
Analytical skills to implement effective AI strategies.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to work effectively with stakeholders.
Ability to translate business requirements into user-friendly AI-enabled solutions.
Hands-on experience with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) on tabular data.







What we offer:

Join a company with a purposeful vision and mission.
Direct influence on the growth and success of Lyfegen.
The possibility to work flexibly.
Become part of a team of international high performers.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer(SAN497)
Description:
Job Description


An AI Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and deploying machine learning and artificial intelligence systems.
They use advanced algorithms, mathematical models, and data to create innovative AI solutions.
This role involves developing intelligent systems capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as speech recognition, decision-making, problem-solving, and pattern recognition. Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and AI algorithms.
Analyze complex data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
Build AI-driven applications for various use cases, including automation, predictive analytics, and natural language processing (NLP).
Work with large data sets and clean, preprocess, and analyze data to improve model performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to create scalable AI solutions. Technical Skills:
Python
Java
TensorFlow
PyTorch
Pandas
NumPy
AWS
Hadoop
MongoDB
Docker
Git
Linear Algebra

Title: Junior Developer (Python)
Description:
Squareflow is a growing company founded in 2020 by entrepreneurs (just like you). We embrace technology to create business value with Odoo as an enabler. We believe that any business can be digital first.




To strengthen our team, we are looking for junior developer. As a developer, you'll be in regular contact with clients and our teams in order to deliver solutions based on understanding of their specific needs in terms of business business/IT alignment.




Function:




As a junior developer, your specific tasks and responsibilities may include:




Develop solutions for our clients from many different industries, sectors and company size
Support and maintain those specific solutions
Implement the client's needs in the Odoo solution before configuring it
Create training material and documentation for Odoo users
Deliver informative, well-organized demos to business teams
Accompany and train end-users to the new tool (train the trainer approach) on Odoo and related applications
Develop and maintain processes to continuously monitor data quality
Coordinate test execution to ensure that all technical customizations and configurations follow industry and delivery best practices
Contribute to the daily development of Squareflow




Your profile :




Bachelor or Master degree (preferably in business, engineering or computer science)
Several programming languages ( Python & JavaScript)
Excellent communication (written and oral) in French and English and interpersonal skills
Structural thinking
Ability to learn and evolve quickly
Ability to work autonomously but also in team with a “Can Do attitude”
Creatively and pragmatic in a problem-solving environment
Fast-learner with a specific interest in Digital




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?




More that a technical knowledge combined with our business positioning, we live our values on a daily basis : teamwork, transparency, commitment.




We offer:

A competitive salary package, with car and other benefits
Exciting projects with a strong use of Odoo
The opportunity to grow your superpower in a challenging context
The possibility to follow regular trainings
The opportunity to think, build and adopt beyond solutions




Squareflow is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability or sexual orientation, in any of its activities or operations.

Title: Expert in AI/ NLP/ ML
Description:
Role - Expert in AI/ NLP/ ML [Artificial Intelligence / Natural Language Processing / Machine Learning]

Type - Hybrid

Location - Brussels, Belgium




SPECIFIC EXPERTISE

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:

Minimum 3 years experience and expertise in the command of Python and R proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace, dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.
Minimum 1 year experience (expertise) of Semantic NLP techniques, including semantic representation, text splitting, analysis, similarity and parsing.
Minimum 2 years of hands-on knowledge with Large Language Models (e.g. OpenAI, LLaMa and Mistal)
Outstanding communication skills and ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences.
Excellent command of English. Good command of French.




KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

• Minimum 5 years of professional experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP; Proven experience with Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.

• Excellent knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Network, and/or artificial intelligence frameworks.

• Experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).

• Ability to adapt to evolving technologies and methodologies in AI.

• Experience in cleaning and preparing data for AI/ML models.

• Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g. Docker) for the deployment of AI and machine learning applications. Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.

• Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (Git Hub) and ETL tools (e.g. dbt, Airflow).

• Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.

• Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail.

• Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments.

• Knowledge of European Commission IT environment is an asset.

Title: Expert Data Scientist
Description:

Title: AI Engineer (SN0647)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking an AI Engineer with expertise in deep learning, NLP, reinforcement learning, and MLOps to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI solutions.


The ideal candidate will work on predictive analytics, autonomous systems, generative AI, and real-time processing while ensuring fairness, transparency, and scalability in AI models.


Key Responsibilities


Advanced AI Modeling: Develop and implement deep learning, reinforcement learning, and graph neural networks for predictive analytics, automated trading, and decision-making systems.
NLP Applications: Build state-of-the-art NLP solutions for sentiment analysis, document processing, and customer interaction using spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers, and OpenAI APIs.
Vector Search & Semantic Retrieval: Design real-time, context-aware data retrieval systems using vector databases like Weaviate, Pinecone, and Milvus.
Agentic Systems: Develop autonomous multi-agent systems for dynamic decision-making in complex environments, such as trading and finance.
MLOps Integration: Deploy and scale AI models using MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Serving, and Seldon for production-ready workflows.
Big Data Engineering: Architect high-performance data pipelines using Apache Spark, Kafka, and Hadoop for real-time and batch processing.
Generative AI: Implement GPT, DALL-E, GANs, and other generative models for innovative AI applications in content generation and user experience.
Transformers & Architectures: Utilize advanced transformer models such as BERT, T5, and ViT for NLP and computer vision tasks.
AI Explainability & Fairness: Ensure transparency and bias mitigation in AI models using SHAP, LIME, and Fairlearn.
Optimization & Hyperparameter Tuning: Enhance model performance with tools like Optuna and Ray Tune.
Cloud & Edge AI: Deploy scalable AI solutions on AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure, optimizing for edge computing with TensorFlow Lite and NVIDIA Jetson.


Required Skills & Qualifications


Programming Expertise
Deep Learning Frameworks
Data Tools
Vector Databases
Reinforcement Learning
Generative AI Models
MLOps & Automation
Real-Time Processing


Soft Skills


Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
Effective team collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Title: Founding AI Engineer
Description:
Plain is redefining customer support for the next generation of B2B companies. We’re building the fastest, most powerful platform to help companies move beyond reactive support and build true customer relationships.

B2B customer support is undergoing a seismic shift. AI is transforming the way companies engage with customers, shifting support from a siloed function to a company-wide effort across Slack, Discord, and in-product experiences. The old way – slow, manual, and disconnected – no longer works.

Some of the world’s most forward-thinking companies – like Stytch, Sanity, and Fly.io – trust Plain to unify all customer interactions, enable faster team collaboration, and supercharge their workflows with AI.

What you’ll do

We’re in a rare position. We’ve already built a deeply scalable, lightning-fast support platform that high-growth companies love. AI has been at the core of our product for a while now – but now, we want to take it to the next level. We have the opportunity to define how AI powers customer support at every level, from automating workflows to deeply understanding customer needs.

This is where you come in.

We’re looking for a sharp, fast-moving, and customer-obsessed Founding AI Engineer to accelerate our AI ambitions. This is a rare chance to shape the AI strategy of an early-stage, high-impact product and help build a category-defining company.

Engineering at Plain isn’t about just moving tickets. It’s about solving complex, high-impact problems – owning them end-to-end, from prototype to production.

In this role, you will:


Define our AI infrastructure and play a key role in shaping our AI strategy.
Own and ship AI-powered features from concept to production.
Solve complex machine learning challenges – especially around AI accuracy, reliability, and quality – using a rigorous, truth-seeking approach.
Serve as the team’s AI expert, helping to build a world-class AI practice.
Advocate for our work externally – writing, speaking, and engaging with the broader AI community.


This is a great fit if you…


Are an experienced backend engineer who’s built AI products in the OpenAI & Anthropic era – especially text- and data-heavy AI applications.
Have AI observability experience. AI isn’t just about shipping features that sound great – it’s about knowing, conclusively, if they’re making things better.
Have a clear perspective on what makes a great AI-powered product. We want to apply AI with precision, nuance, and real impact – not as a gimmick.
Are self-driven, impact-focused, and thrive in a fast-moving, high-ownership environment.
Measure your success by user impact, not just technical elegance.
Bonus: You have a data science background that helps you fine-tune AI accuracy and quality.


This won’t be the right role if you…


Have only academic or research ML/AI experience. We need someone who’s applied AI to real products, not just explored theoretical models.
Think AI for support is just chatbots. B2B support is complex – we’re AI-powering the entire platform, not just automating conversations.
Struggle with ambiguity. We’re an early-stage startup. Things change quickly, and often, knowing what to work on is as important as the work itself.
Prioritize working with the latest tech for its own sake. We choose tools that make us productive – not what’s trendy. (Postgres is great.)
Are looking for a management role. This is a hands-on individual contributor position.
Want the perks of a big company. We offer competitive compensation for our stage, but we’re a startup – this is a different kind of opportunity.


Note: We are an equal-opportunity employer and remote-only company. At this time, we can only support hiring within Europe for this role.

Compensation Range: £75K - £130K


Show more

Title: Python Developer (SN0601)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a Python Developer to design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance web applications and backend services.


The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development, experience with web frameworks like Django, Flask, or FastAPI, and a passion for building efficient and maintainable solutions.


Key Responsibilities


Develop, maintain, and enhance web applications and backend services using Python.
Design and implement scalable APIs and backend logic.
Work closely with product managers, frontend developers, and cross-functional teams to build complete solutions.
Integrate third-party APIs and services into existing systems.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following best practices.
Optimize application performance and scalability.
Conduct troubleshooting, debugging, and issue resolution.
Ensure high-quality software through automated testing, code reviews, and CI/CD pipelines.
Adhere to modern development practices, including version control (Git) and DevOps principles.


Required Skills & Qualifications


3+ years of experience in Python development, with a focus on web applications.
Python frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.
Strong understanding of RESTful API design and development.
relational databases and/or NoSQL databases
frontend technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills


Languages


English

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Main Tasks:

Design and implement AI solutions in collaboration with team management and the AI technical lead.
Propose or support machine learning models and use NLP techniques to derive insights from large datasets.
Contribute to the development of generative AI solutions for knowledge management.
Collaborate with colleagues across teams to analyze business requirements and translate them into AI solutions.
Stay updated on AI developments within the client.
Attend AI-related meetings and prepare briefings for management.




Required Experience

Professional Experience:

Experience in developing AI solutions, including machine learning and NLP techniques.
Proven expertise with Deep Learning models and NLP applications.

Technical Skills:

Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms (k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, etc.).
Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (Docker).
Ability to clean and prepare data for AI/ML models.
Proficiency in database design, data models, data mining, and segmentation.

Advanced Tools & Expertise:

Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL (preferred).
Proficiency with version control systems (GitHub) and ETL tools (dbt, Airflow).

Specific Expertise:

Experience with Python and R using libraries such as:
NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, SpaCy, NLTK, PyTorch, TensorFlow, HuggingFace.
R-specific tools like dplyr, stringr, tidymodels, torch for R, ggplot.
Expertise in Semantic NLP techniques (text splitting, semantic representation, analysis, etc.).
Experience with Large Language Models (e.g., OpenAI, LLaMa, Mistal).
