Title: Senior ML Engineer (NLP)
Description:
About Smartcat

Smartcat is on a mission to become the wall-to-wall Language AI platform, addressing the diverse needs in multilingual content for various user personas within global enterprises.

Smartcat is uniquely positioned within the $100+ billion multilingual content industry, which is currently served by tens of thousands of agencies. This results in a highly fragmented and inefficient supply chain, high costs, unacceptable turnaround times, and quality issues. Using highly qualified internal resources to translate or create multilingual content (insourcing) solves the quality problem for enterprises, but if done manually, it can't solve for scalability, high cost, and slow turnaround.

Smartcat changes the ROI equation in favor of insourcing with its Language AI platform for enterprise end-users. It delivers high-quality, instantaneous AI translations or generates new content in any language by tapping into a customer-specific multilingual content library. The AI output is further refined through human editing by the client's internal reviewers or experts from the Smartcat's embedded global marketplace of linguists and content editors. This AI output continuously improves through the editing feedback loop, ensuring consistent and customer-tailored results.

More than 1,000 global companies including ~20% of the Fortune 1,000 trust Smartcat to communicate their innovations and ideas all over the world.

As a dynamic Series C company, Smartcat is growing at 130% YoY, thanks to the high and quick ROI it delivers to global enterprises. It's well-funded by notable VCs, and is capital efficient, offering a unique blend of hyper-growth potential with downside protection and the capacity for long-term planning and strategy.

Mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be at the forefront of advancing our platform’s translation capabilities. Leveraging your expertise in machine learning including applied research, fine tuning, benchmarking, and inference optimization, you will deliver high-performance solutions that power critical features for our growing client base.

Requirements


Experience with relevant SOTA, LLM tuning, and LLM benchmarking
Experience deploying heavy transformers and optimizing inference
In-depth understanding of the full lifecycle of ML projects
Strong Python skills


Key Responsibilities


Develop and improve benchmarks for translation problems
Enhance automatic translation quality scoring system
Automate fine-tuning/customization of translation engines
Set up infrastructure for self-hosted solutions
Work with NER, word alignment, and other problems


Our technologies


ML: Python, PyTorch, Transformers, Weights & Biases, Label-Studio
DB: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch
Messaging: Apache Kafka
Cloud: Amazon AWS
Monitoring: ELK, Prometheus, Grafana


Why joining Smartcat might be your best move so far


Fully remote team We are a global team of 200+ enthusiastic people spread across 30+ countries. We have been fully remote since 2020, with some locations populated with more Smartcaters than others, such as Boston, NYC, SF, the Bay Area, London, and Lisbon.
Innovating a $100 Billion industry Smartcat’s innovative approach towards multilingual content, taps into a $100B industry. Our platform enables enterprise end users to stop using traditional outsourcing methods, and start enjoying an easy-to-use, AI-powered SaaS, that delivers immediate high-quality results, at a fraction of the cost.
High impact role enabling innovation and inclusion in organizations You will enjoy building with us. You will drive changes in how an old-fashioned global language industry operates while improving how hundreds of thousands of people work and millions of people exchange knowledge and ideas worldwide.
Join the rocketship to scale-up 10x and beyond together We are looking for someone to become an integral part of our team and play a crucial role in the most exciting part of our journey: transitioning from a post-Series C startup to a company exceeding $100M in ARR and $1B in valuation. Our journey isn’t for the faint of heart. We are growing at 130% YoY, thanks to our strong product-market fit and high-performing team, and plan to accelerate from here.
Smartcat Culture: Where Diversity Meets High Performance At Smartcat, we are committed to building a culture that highlights respect and appreciation for each individual's unique background and perspective, while maintaining a strong focus on results and clear, honest and direct communication. We believe in welcoming everyone and fostering an inclusive environment where team members can be their authentic selves at work. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is steadfast, and we stand firmly against discrimination and harassment.

Title: AI Solutions Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about AI-driven solutions and cutting-edge technology? We’re looking for an AI Solutions Engineer to join one of our Biotech clients and play a crucial role in developing and optimizing intelligent applications.




Responsibilities




Design and develop AI-powered applications, enhancing their efficiency and adaptability.
Architect scalable AI solutions that align with industry standards and best practices.
Conduct rigorous testing and validation to ensure system reliability and effectiveness.
Implement and refine dynamic prompt engineering strategies.
Develop and maintain ETL pipelines to ensure seamless data processing and integration.




Qualifications




Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or related field.
Proficiency in Python and Pytorch.
Full proficiency in LLM fine-tuning, GenAI, and prompt engineering.
Expertise in retrieval-based AI, including vector databases and graph-based search techniques.
Strong background in ETL pipeline development and data management.
Fluency in SQL, NoSQL, and graph databases.




Can this role be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send your CV and contact information to g.andrade@panda-int.com, and we will be in touch for a conversation.

Title: Data Scientist II - Agriculture Analytics (Machine Learning / Geospatial)
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

Your Impact

You will leverage industry knowledge and analytical expertise to provide insights both to clients as part of client service teams and within the agricultural analytics team (ACRE) by strengthening the core products and algorithms we build for clients. You can expect to split your time delivering impact at clients (including up to ~50% travel to client sites) and building up ACRE’s core analytical offerings.

As a member of client service teams, you will leverage your creativity and problem-solving skills to tackle clients’ most pressing issues using an analytical lens, meeting client needs and communicating your work to executive audiences. Issues to solve could include determining the suitability (now and in the future given impacts of climate change) of growing different types of crops across different geographies, using local agronomic data and satellite imagery to determine market potential for input products, or optimizing farm operations using yield forecasting. Your work will often include heavy geospatial components and/or predictive analytics components.

When working internally with the ACRE team, you will build innovative algorithms and products (what we call “IP development”) to best meet our most common client needs. You will use global data such as geospatial, biological, economic and climatological data to develop proprietary solutions. You will work with our engineers to design new interfaces to deliver faster, more impactful insights to our clients.

Along the way, you will receive best-in-class training in structuring business problems and serving as a client adviser and have opportunities to work closely with and learn from our senior agriculture practitioners and industry players that are shaping the future of food production. You will get access to unparalleled career acceleration, with a huge amount of ownership and responsibility from the get-go in a collaborative, diverse, non-hierarchical environment. You will get the opportunity to travel to client sites, locally and around the world. Lastly, you will be able to provide direct and measurable impact to some of the largest agribusiness players around the globe.

We encourage you to submit a cover letter to highlight why you believe that you are a unique fit for our team and what we do! We will read it.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a quantitative and/or agriculture-related discipline, such as data science/computer science, crop science/agronomy, animal sciences, geography/GIS, mathematics/statistics, environmental sciences & engineering
Agronomy/crop science, animal sciences, field-level yield forecasting experience preferred
Geospatial and spatiotemporal analysis, remote sensing, image processing experience preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
Proven experience in applying data science and machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, preferably in the agriculture sector
Strong proficiency in Python to develop clean, efficient pipelines and workflows, ensuring reproducibility and effective team collaboration
Experience with version control and frameworks methodologies, preferred
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Strong multitasking and parallel development abilities
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Creative, naturally curious, and willing to take intellectual risks
Able to work under competing, quickly changing priorities, manage expectations effectively and support the team under pressure; highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Willingness to travel up to 50%
Self-management skills and ability to work as part of an Agile team preferred
Show more

You’ll work with McKinsey’s agricultural analytics team (ACRE) in Brussels.

Our Agriculture Practice advises agribusiness, consumer food, government, and investor clients on strategic, marketing & sales, and operations issues, helping support industry-shaping decisions that impact the future of global food production.

Within this group, ACRE is a team of expert consultants, data scientists, and engineers focused on bringing cutting-edge analytics to our agribusiness clients. We apply real-time data and advanced analytics – generally predictive or geospatial in nature – to solve the biggest problems currently facing global agricultural markets, driving insights at the micro and macro levels.

ACRE is an agile team within the firm whose goal is to use the latest analytical methods, incubate new technologies and drive innovative ways to develop new opportunities for the firm to make significant and lasting client impact – redefining what it means to provide the “best of the firm” to our clients.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Freelance
Description:
Rejoignez une mission stratégique et à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d'un groupe reconnu en Belgique !




Nous recherchons activement un(e) Senior Data Scientist (freelance) pour accompagner une entreprise leader en Belgique dans ses projets de transformation digitale et d’exploitation avancée des données.




Notre partenaire est un acteur clé dans le secteur de la mobilité, reconnu pour son engagement dans la durabilité, l’innovation et l'excellence de ses services.




Basé(e) dans la Région Bruxelloise, vous interviendrez sur des missions à fort impact stratégique, allant de l’analyse exploratoire des données à la mise en place de modèles prédictifs et de solutions d’intelligence artificielle, au service de la performance et de la prise de décisions.




Vos responsabilités :

Exploiter et analyser les données pour identifier des tendances et extraire des insights exploitables.
Concevoir et entraîner des modèles prédictifs et des algorithmes de machine learning pour résoudre des problèmes spécifiques du client.
Utiliser des techniques avancées de statistiques, de modélisation et de science des données pour optimiser la prise de décision.
Collaborer étroitement avec les Data Engineers et les Data Analysts pour assurer la qualité, la structuration et la visualisation des données.
Communiquer les résultats aux équipes métier à travers des rapports, des visualisations interactives et des présentations claires et synthétiques.




Votre profil :

Minimum 5 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist, avec une expertise en analyse et modélisation avancée.
Solides compétences en statistiques, mathématiques, machine learning et deep learning.
Maîtrise des langages et outils de data science : Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, SQL.
Expertise en visualisation de données avec Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly ou des outils BI.
Une connaissance des architectures cloud et big data (AWS, Azure, GCP, Spark) est un plus.
Capacité à comprendre et résoudre des problématiques complexes, avec une approche analytique et stratégique.
Excellente communication et capacité à traduire des concepts techniques en recommandations claires pour les équipes métier.
Bon niveau de français et d’anglais, permettant une collaboration efficace avec différentes parties prenantes. La connaissance du néerlandais est un atout.




Notre offre :

Une mission stratégique et à forte valeur ajoutée au sein d'un groupe reconnu en Belgique.
Un contrat freelance dans le cadre d’un projet de longue durée, à fort impact social.
Une rémunération compétitive prenant en compte le niveau d'expertise du candidat ou de la candidate.
Un travail en mode hybride, avec des possibilités de télétravail.




Cette belle opportunité vous intéresse ? N'hésitez plus à postuler car cette annonce ne tardera pas à disparaître ! Notre recherche est urgente.

Show more

Title: AI Expert ( NLP, ML)
Description:
Hello,

We are called People More because we treat our employees with respect, but also because the projects we work on are for people and should be easy and pleasant to use. We are technological, but we look at the bigger picture :)

People More has been in existence for over three years and is an offshoot of one of the country's oldest interactive agencies - Insignia. The company is made up of people with a huge client base in the country and abroad, for whom we build projects from scratch (UX, UI, frontend, backend, mobile) or in part. We work directly for our clients and also support our partners in their own solutions. This ensures a wide range of projects and the ability to change! We work with clients all over the world.

For the project that we are working on with our foreign partner, we are looking for AI Expert (NLP / ML)

Your Duties Will Include


Developing and optimizing AI/ML and NLP models using advanced algorithms.
Deploying AI solutions in the cloud and utilizing containerization and version control.
Analyzing, modeling, and processing data, including exploration and segmentation.
Tracking new AI technologies and supporting their integration with IT systems.


Requirements That Must Be Met


At least 5 years of professional experience in AI development, including machine learning and NLP.
Proven expertise in Deep Learning models and NLP techniques.
Strong command of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as k-NN, Naïve Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Neural Networks, and AI frameworks.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is an advantage.
Ability to adapt to evolving AI technologies and methodologies.
Hands-on experience in data preparation and cleaning for AI and machine learning models.
Minimum 3 years of experience with cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker) for AI/ML application deployment.
Knowledge of Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is a plus.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control systems (GitHub/GitLab) and ETL tools (e.g., Data Services, Talend, etc.).
Strong technical proficiency in database design, data modeling, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Relocation to Belgium required
Very good English and Polish


What We Offer


We are open and honest and we solve problems instead of generating them.
Maybe it’s obvious, but we really respect our employees and associates. We used to be software developers, too, and we appreciate that job!
A small team
An international working environment and international projects
Private medical care
Sports card
Training courses
Hybrid work in Belgium


If you are not sure if you meet the requirements, apply—we’ll talk and give you an honest answer.

Why it’s a good idea to work with People More?


If you are not satisfied with your work or your tasks, we’ll find a way out together!
If you get bored, we will offer you a new product and new, fascinating tasks
We will work on your brand together: you will get an opportunity to attend conferences, including as a speaker, and we will help you publish in recognized magazines and online
We will facilitate your access to challenges that are usually difficult to get
At any time, you can talk directly to the board of People More—we talk your language because the company’s founders are software developers and designers!


What does the recruitment process look like?


A friendly remote initial interview
A remote technical talk
The decision to work together!


Salary

230 - 300 zł/h

contract

B2B

Location

Belgium / Brussels
Show more

Title: AI Engineer(SAN497)
Description:
Job Description


An AI Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and deploying machine learning and artificial intelligence systems.
They use advanced algorithms, mathematical models, and data to create innovative AI solutions.
This role involves developing intelligent systems capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as speech recognition, decision-making, problem-solving, and pattern recognition. Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models and AI algorithms.
Analyze complex data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
Build AI-driven applications for various use cases, including automation, predictive analytics, and natural language processing (NLP).
Work with large data sets and clean, preprocess, and analyze data to improve model performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to create scalable AI solutions. Technical Skills:
Python
Java
TensorFlow
PyTorch
Pandas
NumPy
AWS
Hadoop
MongoDB
Docker
Git
Linear Algebra


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail

Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer you promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the Machine Learning and AI community. You do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.




You participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means you contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.




AND IN DETAIL

You facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.
You work with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry …).
You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests …).
You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.




YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES

A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
You have at least 3 years of relevant experience with:

- Basic knowledge of Linux platform

- Containerization/virtualization

- AI platforms & IDEs

- CI/CD

- Code, model & data versioning

- Python

- Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management

- PostgreSQL

It is preferable you have experience with:

- Integration using different technologies and infra components

- Model compression techniques

- ELT/ETL tools

- Big data tools (Spark)

- Data flow processing

- Data visualization tools

You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback.
You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success.




WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.




YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.




OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.




OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.




TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.




Good luck!




Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: AI Engineer (SN0647)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking an AI Engineer with expertise in deep learning, NLP, reinforcement learning, and MLOps to develop and deploy cutting-edge AI solutions.


The ideal candidate will work on predictive analytics, autonomous systems, generative AI, and real-time processing while ensuring fairness, transparency, and scalability in AI models.


Key Responsibilities


Advanced AI Modeling: Develop and implement deep learning, reinforcement learning, and graph neural networks for predictive analytics, automated trading, and decision-making systems.
NLP Applications: Build state-of-the-art NLP solutions for sentiment analysis, document processing, and customer interaction using spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers, and OpenAI APIs.
Vector Search & Semantic Retrieval: Design real-time, context-aware data retrieval systems using vector databases like Weaviate, Pinecone, and Milvus.
Agentic Systems: Develop autonomous multi-agent systems for dynamic decision-making in complex environments, such as trading and finance.
MLOps Integration: Deploy and scale AI models using MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Serving, and Seldon for production-ready workflows.
Big Data Engineering: Architect high-performance data pipelines using Apache Spark, Kafka, and Hadoop for real-time and batch processing.
Generative AI: Implement GPT, DALL-E, GANs, and other generative models for innovative AI applications in content generation and user experience.
Transformers & Architectures: Utilize advanced transformer models such as BERT, T5, and ViT for NLP and computer vision tasks.
AI Explainability & Fairness: Ensure transparency and bias mitigation in AI models using SHAP, LIME, and Fairlearn.
Optimization & Hyperparameter Tuning: Enhance model performance with tools like Optuna and Ray Tune.
Cloud & Edge AI: Deploy scalable AI solutions on AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure, optimizing for edge computing with TensorFlow Lite and NVIDIA Jetson.


Required Skills & Qualifications


Programming Expertise
Deep Learning Frameworks
Data Tools
Vector Databases
Reinforcement Learning
Generative AI Models
MLOps & Automation
Real-Time Processing


Soft Skills


Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
Effective team collaboration across cross-functional teams.

Title: Python Developer (SN0601)
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a Python Developer to design, develop, and maintain scalable and high-performance web applications and backend services.


The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python development, experience with web frameworks like Django, Flask, or FastAPI, and a passion for building efficient and maintainable solutions.


Key Responsibilities


Develop, maintain, and enhance web applications and backend services using Python.
Design and implement scalable APIs and backend logic.
Work closely with product managers, frontend developers, and cross-functional teams to build complete solutions.
Integrate third-party APIs and services into existing systems.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following best practices.
Optimize application performance and scalability.
Conduct troubleshooting, debugging, and issue resolution.
Ensure high-quality software through automated testing, code reviews, and CI/CD pipelines.
Adhere to modern development practices, including version control (Git) and DevOps principles.


Required Skills & Qualifications


3+ years of experience in Python development, with a focus on web applications.
Python frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.
Strong understanding of RESTful API design and development.
relational databases and/or NoSQL databases
frontend technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, and automated testing.
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills


Languages


English

Title: Solver - Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
About Exsolvæ:

Exsolvæ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Science, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.




At Exsolvæ, our "Solvers" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.




We are seeking a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist with a proven ability to design, develop, and deploy transformative AI and machine learning solutions.




Your Role:

As a Data Science & Machine Learning Specialist, you will work alongside multidisciplinary teams to unlock the full potential of data assets for clients. You will design state-of-the-art ML models, develop data-driven insights, and deploy production-grade AI solutions. Leveraging your expertise, you will help clients overcome their most pressing challenges and create sustainable value using AI and ML.




What We’re Looking For:




Required Skills and Qualifications

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
Programming Skills: Expertise in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark or Databricks.
Machine Learning Mastery: Proficiency in TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn for designing, training, and deploying ML models.
Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI for scalable AI deployments.
Data Visualization: Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Python-based libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.
Statistics and Mathematics: Deep understanding of linear algebra, calculus, probability, and advanced statistical techniques.
Soft Skills: Exceptional communication, critical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.




Preferred Skills

Familiarity with advanced ML techniques, such as reinforcement learning, graph ML, and large language models (LLMs).
Experience with MLOps tools like MLflow, Kubeflow, and Docker/Kubernetes.
Knowledge of causal inference frameworks (e.g., DoWhy, EconML) and time-series forecasting methods.
Certifications such as Microsoft Certified: Azure AI Engineer Associate, AWS Certified Machine Learning, or Google Professional ML Engineer.




What You’ll Do:




Core Expertise

Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to identify data challenges, define objectives, and recommend AI/ML solutions that align with business goals.
Model Development: Design and train advanced machine learning models using frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Insight Generation: Transform complex datasets into actionable insights using statistical analysis and advanced visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.




Technical Implementation

Machine Learning Solutions: Develop models for classification, regression, clustering, and NLP using modern techniques, including deep learning and reinforcement learning.
Data Engineering: Collaborate with Data Engineers to build robust data pipelines and optimize data for ML applications using platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.
MLOps: Deploy and maintain models in production environments using MLOps pipelines with tools like MLflow or Kubeflow.
Cloud Deployment: Implement AI workflows on cloud platforms such as Azure Machine Learning, AWS SageMaker, or GCP Vertex AI with scalability and performance in mind.




Research and Innovation

Stay updated on advancements in AI/ML technologies and incorporate state-of-the-art practices into client projects.
Explore innovative methodologies like transfer learning, Vision Transformers, and graph neural networks to enhance solutions.




Project Management

Lead end-to-end ML projects, from problem definition to model deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Engineers and Solution Architects, to deliver comprehensive solutions.




Training and Support

Conduct workshops and training sessions to empower client teams in adopting and managing AI/ML solutions.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed AI systems.




Why Join Us?

Impactful Projects: Work on transformative AI/ML initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, retail, and energy.
Continuous Learning: Access to the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of AI and ML.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values knowledge sharing and collective growth.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.




If you are a driven professional with a passion for Artificial Intelligence and a proven ability to design and deploy impactful AI/ML solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist _FR
Description:
Comment pouvez-vous faire la différence ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist au sein de notre Direction Customer Services, vous jouez un rôle clé dans l’analyse de nos bases de données afin de définir la stratégie commerciale pour le clients B2B et B2C de la SNCB, tant au niveau national qu’international. Vous rejoignez le département Customer Data, responsable de l'analyse des données clients, de l'automatisation du marketing et de la gestion des données clients.

Quel est votre rôle à la SNCB ?

Au sein du département Customer Data, vous serez responsable de l'analyse d'ensembles de données volumineux et complexes, du développement de modèles prédictifs et de la fourniture d'informations qui soutiennent les décisions stratégiques de la SNCB.

En tant que Data Scientist:


Vous développez de nouveaux modèles stratégiques et marketing et améliorer les modèles existants (ex: modèle de prospection pour le segment B2B pour les Account Managers).
Vous analysez et interprétez les données des voyageurs pour fournir des informations stratégiques à certains Head of d’autres départements.
Vous développez des visuels et des rapports dans des outils tels que Power BI pour présenter les résultats de manière claire, syntétique, accessible et convainquante.
Vous effectuez des analyses de données géographiques et spatiales et vous soutenez les analyses de transport.
Vous collaborez de manière transversale au sein de l'entreprise. Vous agissez en tant que conseiller et personne de confiance en matière de données clients.


Un job fait pour vous ?


Vous êtes titulaire d'un diplôme de master (ou équivalent par expérience) dans une orientation pertinente (par exemple, analyse de données, statistiques, géographie, économie, ingénieur civil, ... ) ET vous disposez ’au moins 3 ans d’expérience comme Data Analyst.


Vous vous reconnaissez dans les compétences suivantes:


Vous maîtrisez les techniques d'analyse mutlivariables et avez de l'expérience dans la gestion et l'analyse de données géographiques.
Vous êtes capable d'utiliser des outils de visualisation et d'analyse de données tels que Power BI et PySpark.
En tant qu’excellent communicateur, vous savez expliquer clairement et efficacement des idées complexes à différents interlocuteurs.
Vous pouvez diriger des projets techniquement complexes et coacher vos collègues pour atteindre les objectifs fixés.
Vous êtes capable de résoudre des problèmes de manière creative et dans la collaboration avec des équipes transversales au sein de la SNCB.
Vous vous adaptez facilement aux besoins du projet et aux attentes des parties prenantes internes.
Vous comprenez une conversation en néerlandais.


Chaque personne est unique. Il est important pour nous que vous puissiez être vous-même. C’est ce qui rend la SNCB plus forte. C’est pourquoi nous accordons beaucoup d’importance à la diversité et à l’inclusion.

Qu'avons-nous à vous offrir ?

En tant que Senior Data Scientist, vous choisissez un job qui a un impact sur la stratégie commerciale de la SNCB. Vous vous trouverez dans un environnement de travail agréable, avec une pertinence sociétale et vous êtes entouré de collègues motivés et sympathiques.

En outre, vous pouvez compter sur :


Un salaire attractif complété d'un 13e mois, d'une indemnité de frais, des chèques-repas et d'un bonus collectif et individuel.
Une partie du salaire est offerte sous forme de budget flexible. Vous pouvez opter pour la location d'un vélo, d’une voiture flex, pour le remboursement de l'épargne-pension, etc.
Une assurance hospitalisation et collective.
Un horaire flexible, un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à 33 jours de congés par an.
Un abonnement de train en Belgique, des avantages sur les lignes internationales et une indemnité vélo.
Des avantages pour votre famille comme des réductions sur les sorties en famille et dans les magasins.


Où allez-vous travailler ?

Vous travaillez à Bruxelles dans la Direction Customer Services, à proximité de la gare de Bruxelles-Midi et à domicile. Vous rejoignez l’équipe Customer Data composée de 8 personnes.

What’s next ?


Vous postulez sur notre jobsite
Nous analysons votre CV et votre motivation.
Nous vous invitons à un entretien de sélection (en ligne). Afin de préparer cet entretien, nous vous demanderons de compléter un questionnaire de personnalité et un test de raisonnement en ligne.
Dans un second temps, et afin de vous donner une bonne idée de la fonction, nous vous soumettrons un case study éliminatoire.
Si le case study est concluant, un deuxième entretien sera organisé si nécessaire.
Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !


Avez-vous encore des questions?

Jobreq: 50260

Sur le contenu de la fonction

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@sncb.be

Sur la procédure de sélection :

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

  • Tout se déroule de manière positive ? Nous vous faisons une proposition de contrat.
  • Vous êtes prêt·e pour votre premier jour de travail !

Avez-vous encore des questions?

Title: Experienced Data scientist - Region Brussels
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

The Tribe Artificial Intelligence aims to deliver an efficient and seamless banking experience for our customers and empower our employees through AI. Our expert team of approximately 90 experts includes Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Business Analysts, Scrum Masters, Product Owners and Managers. We are seeking a Data Scientist with a minimum of 3 years of experience in developing AI applications, including both generative and predictive AI.

AND IN DETAIL


You develop AI applications to address various business challenges, including virtual assistants to enhance client experiences, advanced AI tools to support employee efficiency and creativity, and automation to optimize internal processes.
You use various analytical methods, including large language models (Prompt Engineering, RAG, Fine-tuning), speech-to-text, agentic AI applications, image generation and interpretation, and classical statistical/machine learning techniques. While expertise in all areas is not required, strong proficiency in core technologies and the ability to learn new methods as needed are essential.
You contribute to deploying AI applications in production using a comprehensive stack of tools.
You access one of the richest volumes of varied data in the market and apply your skills to it.
You evolve in an environment where innovation and lean processes are praised, straight-forward communication is encouraged, and peers understand the meaning of team up.
You work with a team of colleagues in an Agile organization who are ready to collaborate and to share their experience.


YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES


You hold at least a Master’s degree in a quantitative field like statistics, computer science or engineering, with a focus on natural language processing. A PhD is advantageous. Candidates from other academic backgrounds with strong analytics knowledge are also welcome.
You have a minimum of 3 years' experience in data science, preferably in the financial sector, though less experience may be accepted if your academic achievements are substantial.
You are fluent in English and have a good command of French and/or Dutch.
You are proficient in Python for model building and understand ML engineering fundamentals (e.g., versioning systems) to produce code ready for CI/CD integration.


What We Have To Offer

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact that the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we are working towards a better future every day.

YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and goals.

OUR OFFER

In addition to your remuneration and benefits (meal vouchers, insurance, holidays), we offer flexible salary options, allowing you to convert part of your salary into personalised benefits (phone use, IT equipment, transport, etc.).

OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis. 

TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you. Good luck!

Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hoe maak jij mee het verschil?

Als Senior Data Scientist speel je een sleutelrol in de analyse van databases om de commerciële B2B- en B2C-strategie te bepalen zowel voor nationale als internationale klanten. Je komt terecht op de afdeling Customer Data, verantwoordelijk voor klantdata-analyse, marketing automation en customer data management.

Wat is jouw rol bij NMBS ?

Als Senior Data Scientist ben je verantwoordelijk voor de analyse van grote en complexe datasets, de ontwikkeling van voorspellende modellen en de informatievoorziening die de strategische beslissingen van NMBS ondersteunt.

Dat betekent:


Je ontwikkelt nieuwe strategische- en marketingmodellen en verbetert bestaande modellen (bv. prospectiemodel voor het B2B-segment voor Account Managers).
Je analyseert en interpreteert reizigersgegevens om strategische inzichten te verschaffen aan managers van andere afdelingen.
Je ontwikkelt visuals en rapporten in tools zoals Power BI om de resultaten op een duidelijke, beknopte, toegankelijke en overtuigende manier te presenteren.
Je voert geografische en ruimtelijke data-analyses uit en ondersteunt transportanalyses.
Je hebt een transversale rol . Je treedt op als adviseur en vertrouwenspersoon als het gaat om klantgegevens.


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je hebt een masterdiploma in een relevante richting (bvb. data-analyse, statistiek, geografie, economie, ingenieurswetenschappen, ...) EN je hebt een eerste professionele ervaring (van minstens 5 jaar) als data analist.


Je herkent jezelf in de volgende competenties:


Je bent bedreven in multivariate analysetechnieken en hebt ervaring in het beheren en analyseren van geografische gegevens.
Je kunt tools voor gegevensvisualisatie en -analyse gebruiken, zoals Power BI en PySpark.
Als uitstekende communicator weet je complexe ideeën helder en effectief uit te leggen aan verschillende gesprekspartners.
Je kunt technisch complexe projecten leiden en je collega's coachen om de gestelde doelen te bereiken.
Je bent in staat om problemen creatief en samen met cross-functionele teams binnen NMBS op te lossen.
Je kunt je gemakkelijk aanpassen aan de behoeften van het project en de verwachtingen van interne belanghebbenden.
Je begrijpt een gesprek in het Frans.


Elke persoon is uniek. Het is belangrijk voor ons dat je jezelf kunt zijn. Dat is wat NMBS sterker maakt. Daarom hechten we veel belang aan diversiteit en inclusie.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?

Als Senior Data Scientist kies je voor een job die impact heeft op de commerciële strategie van NMBS. Je komt terecht in een prettige werkomgeving, met maatschappelijke relevantie en je wordt omringd door gemotiveerde en vriendelijke collega's.

Daarnaast kan je rekenen op:


Een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met een 13de maand, een onkostenvergoeding, maaltijdcheques en een collectieve en individuele bonus.
Een deel van het salaris wordt aangeboden in de vorm van een flexibel budget. Je kan kiezen voor fietslease, flexwagen, terugbetaling pensioensparen, enz.
Een hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering.
Een flexibel uurrooster, een goede balans tussen werk en privé dankzij 33 vrije dagen per jaar.
Een treinabonnement in België, voordelen op internationale lijnen en een fietsvergoeding.
Voordelen voor je gezin, zoals kortingen op familie-uitjes en in winkelketens.


Waar ga je werken?

Je werkt in Brussel op de afdeling Customer Services, vlak bij het station Brussel-Zuid en van thuis uit. Je komt terecht in het Customer Data team dat bestaat uit 8 collega’s.

What’s next ?


Je solliciteert op onze jobsite.
We bekijken je cv en je motivatie.
We nodigen je uit voor een online gesprek om kennis te maken. Om je voor te bereiden op dit gesprek, vragen wij je een persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst en een online redeneertest in te vullen.
In een tweede fase, en om je een goed idee van de functie te geven, zullen wij je een eliminerende casestudy voorleggen.
Als de case study overtuigend is, wordt, indien nodig; een tweede gesprek georganiseerd.
Verloopt alles positief? Dan doen wij je een contractvoorstel.
Je bent klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Over de inhoud van de functie

Lander Bijnens

Lander.bijnens@nmbs.be

Over de selectieprocedure:

Anne-Sophie Heyvaert

Annesophie.heyvaert@nmbs.be

+32 499 06 55 75

Title: DEVELOPPEUR C/C++
Description:
Freelance
Bruxelles
Publié il y a 4 mois


RED TIC recherchons un Développeur C/C++ passionné et talentueux pour rejoindre notre équipe de développement. Vous serez responsable de la conception, du développement et de l’optimisation de logiciels performants en C et C++. Vous travaillerez sur des projets innovants dans des domaines variés, en mettant l’accent sur la qualité, la performance et la scalabilité des solutions.

Mission


Développement de logiciels :
Concevoir, coder, tester et maintenir des applications logicielles performantes en C/C++.
Participer à l’architecture des solutions logicielles, en garantissant une performance optimale et une utilisation efficace des ressources.
Implémenter des fonctionnalités nouvelles et des améliorations sur des systèmes existants.
Optimisation et performance :
Analyser les performances des logiciels et proposer des solutions d’optimisation pour garantir des temps de réponse réduits et une gestion optimale des ressources.
Résoudre les problèmes de performance en analysant et en modifiant le code source.
Collaboration avec les équipes :
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les autres développeurs, chefs de projet et ingénieurs pour définir et comprendre les exigences techniques.
Participer aux revues de code, assurer la qualité du code développé et proposer des améliorations.
Support et maintenance :
Diagnostiquer et résoudre les problèmes techniques liés aux applications existantes.
Assurer le suivi et la maintenance des logiciels en production en répondant aux demandes d’assistance et en gérant les incidents.
Documentation technique :
Rédiger une documentation technique claire et complète pour les fonctionnalités développées.
Participer à l’élaboration de la documentation de conception des solutions logicielles.

Profil Recherché

Compétences techniques :


Solide maîtrise des langages C et C++, avec une bonne compréhension des concepts avancés (pointeurs, gestion de mémoire, etc.).
Expérience dans la programmation orientée objet et la gestion des systèmes.
Connaissance des systèmes d’exploitation (Linux, Windows) et des outils de développement associés.
Familiarité avec les bibliothèques C/C++ standard et externes.
Expérience dans l’optimisation des performances des applications.
Connaissance des outils de gestion de version (Git, SVN).


Compétences Analytiques


Capacité à résoudre des problèmes complexes de manière efficace.
Aptitude à analyser des systèmes logiciels existants et à en améliorer la performance.


Qualifications


Diplôme en informatique, génie logiciel ou dans un domaine connexe.
Expérience professionnelle de 2 à 5 ans en développement C/C++ (idéalement dans des environnements exigeants en termes de performance).
Une expérience dans les systèmes embarqués ou le développement de logiciels à faible latence serait un atout.


Pourquoi rejoindre notre entreprise ?


Travailler sur des projets innovants avec des technologies de pointe.
Rejoindre une équipe dynamique et collaborative.
Accéder à des opportunités de développement professionnel et à des formations continues.
Profiter d’un environnement de travail stimulant où l’innovation est au cœur de notre culture.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ref: 533ASISW

Title: Data Scientist - Commodities Trading

Location: Thalwil, Zurich, Switzerland

Salary: Attractive

Date: 19th March 2025




Our client, a leading global financial institution, is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join their team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong background in quantitative methodologies, eager to develop and enhance analytics solutions that drive commodity management decisions. You will collaborate with digital teams and business stakeholders to identify priorities and optimize workflows, leveraging advanced data science techniques.




Duties Include:




Work closely with business teams to identify opportunities where machine learning can enhance decision-making.
Design, develop, and implement end-to-end machine learning models, including regression, classification, text analysis, and time series forecasting.
Collect, process, analyze, and visualize large structured and unstructured datasets from internal and external sources.
Apply appropriate modeling techniques to generate actionable insights and improve analytics solutions.
Monitor and enhance model performance, expanding scope as needed.
Partner with data engineers to build scalable, repeatable data pipelines, ensuring consistency and robustness in analytics applications.
Establish best practices for integration projects and data-driven initiatives.




The preferred candidate should possess experience working with AI systems, Python code and strong knowledge of DevOps practices (e.g., Git, Agile methodology) with additional knowledge in MLOps, model architecture design, and testing patterns) excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to interact at all levels of business efficiently.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please email your C.V. to contact@altussearch.ch or call Altus Search on +41 (0) 41 560 02 21 for a confidential discussion.

Show more

  • Establish best practices for integration projects and data-driven initiatives.


The preferred candidate should possess experience working with AI systems, Python code and strong knowledge of DevOps practices (e.g., Git, Agile methodology) with additional knowledge in MLOps, model architecture design, and testing patterns) excellent communication and interpersonal skills and be able to interact at all levels of business efficiently.


If you are interested in this opportunity, please email your C.V. to contact@altussearch.ch or call Altus Search on +41 (0) 41 560 02 21 for a confidential discussion.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Zurich / Remote

Contract: 6-month Freelance (with possibility of extension)




Company Overview:

DeepRec.ai is collaborating with a rapidly growing, innovative Biotech company focused on transforming Drug Discovery through AI. if you're passionate about AI for Science, we're seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join their growing team.




Job Description:

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be joining a high-impact, mission-driven team working on the forefront of AI research. You'll have the opportunity to contribute to the development of generative modeling techniques and large language models. Your role will involve building and optimizing state-of-the-art deep learning models, deploying them at scale, and working in a collaborative environment with some of the best minds in AI and Biotech.

This is a unique opportunity to make a significant impact at a well-funded, fast-growing company that is defining the future of AI in the Biotech space.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models with a focus on large language models and generative modeling.
Fine-tune and optimize deep learning models at scale, applying advanced hyperparameter tuning techniques.
Collaborate closely with a highly skilled, interdisciplinary team of researchers, engineers, and Biotech experts to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications.
Drive continuous improvements in model performance and scalability.
Stay up-to-date with the latest research and technological advancements in AI/ML and contribute innovative ideas to the team.




Required Skills:

3+ years of industry experience in Machine Learning and AI.
Strong expertise in large language models (LLMs), including experience coding, deploying, evaluating, and fine-tuning these models.
Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar, and a strong understanding of model training and evaluation.
Proficiency in deploying machine learning models at scale in cloud-based environments (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.).
Experience with hyperparameter tuning and optimization techniques.
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques, particularly in generative modeling and NLP.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You will work with other data scientists, data/ML engineers, designers, project managers and business subject matter experts on interdisciplinary projects across various industry sectors to enable business ambitions with data & analytics.

Who You Are

You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tools for the right task, we also take into account client’s current landscape and preferences. Often, we use Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Databricks, SQL, Docker and Kubernetes. We also leverage our own proprietary tools such as Kedro, CuasalNex, MLRun (check out more OSS here https //www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/quantumblack/labs). We work on regular basis with cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP and Azure.

Your Impact

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

Role Responsibilities


Work on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real world problems
Develop high quality data science products and solutions for clients as well as assets for our internal data teams
Focus on modelling, working alongside the Data Engineering team
Present findings, recommendations and provide consultation to stakeholders (internal and clients)


What You’ll Learn


Work across various industries and sectors, gaining insights into diverse business challenges and applications of data science
Build large-scale data & analytics solutions, handling complex problems and advanced client situations
Best practices in data & analytics development including framework, responsibility model, high quality code, data security, sustainability and scalability
Work in collaborative teams with diverse skill sets, fostering effective teamwork and learning from colleagues in a multicultural and creative environment
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science tools, techniques, and technologies as well as first class learning programs
Develop strong client-facing skills, including effective communication, problem-solving, and presentation abilities


Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in (business) maths, statistics, machine learning, data science, physics, computer science or engineering required
Master's degree or PhD level in the field of data science, computer science, business informatics or equivalent is a plus
Up to 2 years of professional hands-on experience in applying advanced data science methods and implementing technical data solutions (e.g. develop machine learning models), in order to solve business problems
A strong grasp of various analytics landscape, including business intelligence, machine learning, AI, and generative AI, and how to apply them effectively in different scenarios
Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud
Proficient communication skills in German and English
Effective communication and presentation skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner adapted to different groups of non-technical audiences e.g. business managers, heads of products, sales & marketing leads
Practical experience in Generative AI application development
Proven record of advisory works
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
Show more

Title: AI Engineer Intern
Description:
We’re a young startup founded in the canton of Uri by a healthy mix of ETH and HSG alumni. Our close-knit team of 10+ is based in Zürich and Altdorf, developing a SaaS solution that helps teams analyze, improve, and track all aspects of their teamwork on a single platform. Our AI-powered teamwork assistant focuses on a team’s key factors for success: communicating effectively, managing time and resources cooperatively, offering constructive feedback, and many more.




Already more than 60 companies like CSS, Axpo, and Smile rely on Moodtalk. Now we want to scale to 1,000+ companies - and we need your help to get there!




We’re looking for a talented AI Engineer Intern who’s curious about exploring teamwork challenges and eager to make an impact. From day one, you’ll be a core member of our team.


Tasks


Your responsibilities…




when developing new AI features will range through the full development cycle:





Understanding customer pain points in close collaboration with our Customer Success team


Selecting the AI tools that balance quality and speed (we ship fast!)


Implementing features in our stack


Evaluating your AI solutions in real-world use cases—and refining them as needed



Requirements


You’re the perfect candidate if you have…





Experience applying modern AI to real-world text data—whether in class projects (nice!), side projects (even better!), or production (perfect!). We specifically look for experience in:


Writing LLM prompts and flows using common API providers


Building, testing, and deploying agents in lang[chain|graph|flow] (or a comparable agentic framework)


Running inference and/or training transformer models in Hugging Face, PyTorch, TensorFlow, or similar


Proficiency in Python and Java (optionally also in Angular or another SPA framework)


Familiarity with a standard toolchain (IntelliJ, Git, Maven, Jira, Confluence)


The curiosity to dig into data until you truly understand the problem at hand


Understanding German is an advantage





If this sounds like you, we’d love to talk.




Setup & Application





80% - 100% payed internship, minimum duration 3 month, start no later than June (asap possible)


Availability for on-site at least once a week in Zürich Oerlikon


To apply, send us your CV and a two sentence teaser why you’d be a good match





This is important to us: Moodtalk is an employer where equal opportunity is provided and diversity is celebrated. We welcome people from different backgrounds who want to help us transform teams into true super teams. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability.

Title: Research Scientist, Machine Learning, Lausanne
Description:
Isomorphic Labs is a new Alphabet company that is reimagining drug discovery through a computational- and AI-first approach.

We are on a mission to accelerate the speed, increase the efficacy and lower the cost of drug discovery. You'll be working at the cutting edge of the new era of 'digital biology' to deliver a transformative social impact for the benefit of millions of people.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring, collaborative and entrepreneurial culture.

Your impact

As a Research Scientist in machine learning (ML), you will play an exciting role in building greenfield machine learning based models and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

Working in a highly creative, fast-paced and interdisciplinary environment, you will be partnering with leading engineers and scientists to conceive, design, and develop cutting edge machine learning algorithms to unlock new modelling and predictive power which will be critical to the organisation’s success. You will draw upon your existing deep research experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

Depending on your experience:

You will create and lead projects, bringing together a variety of disciplined scientists and engineers to pursue some of the most ambitious modelling problems with deep learning - as well as providing technical mentorship and people management for others in the ML community at Isomorphic Labs

You will be instrumental in leading greenfield machine learning based research projects, building the models, and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

What You Will Do


Contribute to our research directions in machine learning by using your extensive knowledge of the field to apply world-leading ML algorithms to drug discovery.
Identify and create novel ML techniques and the required data to train.
Develop the architectures and training algorithms of machine learning models.
Analyse and tune experimental results to inform future experimental directions.
Implement and scale training and inference engineering frameworks.
Report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, to both other ML scientists and scientists of different disciplines.
Iterate collaboratively with scientists and domain experts, sharing your own domain experience.
Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet ambitious research goals.
Depending on your experience:
Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the ML research community, advising on projects, and shaping our research roadmap based on your deep technical expertise.
Provide developmental support to other ML research scientists.
Create, lead, and run ML research projects, fostering collaborative and diverse teams to solve high priority modelling problems.Cultivate a diverse and inclusive research culture.


Essential

Skills and qualifications


PhD or equivalent practical experience in a technical field.
A proven track record in machine learning using deep learning techniques, including designing new architectures, hands-on experimentation, analysis, and visualisation.
Strong knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics.
Experience using ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, and scientific software such as NumPy, SciPy, or Pandas.
A passion for applying ML research to real world problems.
Depending on your experience: project supervision, leadership, or management.


Nice to have


PhD in machine learning or computer science.
Relevant research experience to the position such as post doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications, or contributions to machine learning codebases.
Experience working in a scientific environment across disciplines (particularly biology, chemistry, physics).
Experience working with biological or chemical data and biological or chemistry software.
Experience working with real-world datasets.
Experience with ML on accelerators.
Experience in any of: large scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, deep learning for drug discovery, deep learning for computer vision, 3D graphics/robotics, real-world applied RL.


Culture and values

We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.

Thoughtful

Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.

Brave

Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it’s also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.

Determined

Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It’s a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won’t wait, so neither should we.

Together

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It’s knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we’re doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

Creating An Inclusive Company

We believe that to be successful we need our teams to reflect and represent the populations we are striving to serve. We’re working to build a supportive and inclusive environment where collaboration is encouraged, learning is shared and every employee feels like they truly belong. We value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It’s hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you’re in). As an equal opportunities employer, we are committed to building an equal and inclusive team. If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we’d be happy to talk through these if you’re selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

>> Click to view other open roles at Isomorphic Labs

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
Description:
Software Engineer, Machine Learning




About Chipmind

Chipmind is transforming chip development with AI-driven agents that automate design and verification by solving real-world tasks, accelerating the path from code to chip.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role at Chipmind for a Software Engineer, Machine Learning focused on post-training and AI agents. Join us to accelerate the path from code to chip and push the boundaries of AI-driven chip development.




What we offer

The opportunity to make an impact on how AI develops chips
A competitive compensation package including company equity
An office in the vibrant Zurich Wiedikon district




Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python and Javascript
Familiar with large language models (LLMs) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Pytorch and TensorFlow)
Familiar with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) and containerization (e.g., Docker)
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a strong passion for innovation




Responsibilities

Develop and enhance LLMs and AI agents for improved reasoning and decision-making
Implement RLHF, SFT, DPO, and other post-training methods
Fine-tune LLMs and optimize foundation models
Take part in brainstorming sessions and actively contribute to enhancing our products 
Keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends and developments in AI and machine learning technologies
Ensure robust model alignment and performance

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
Description:
Meta is embarking on the most transformative change to its business and technology in company history, and our Machine Learning Engineers are at the forefront of this evolution. We are seeking a high skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in developing cutting-edge algorithms for future Meta's wearables devices.

Software Engineer, Machine Learning Responsibilities:


Build, iterate and optimize models and experiment to build state-of-the-art performance within wearable devices constraints
Develop and implement data augmentation techniques to improve model performance and robustness
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, software developers, and clinical experts, to integrate ML models into existing systems and products
Evaluate and optimize model performance using various metrics and techniques, such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, and ROC-AUC
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning, signal processing and related fields. Apply this knowledge to improve model performance and innovation
Document and communicate technical findings and results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Participate in code reviews and contribute to the development of best practices for ML engineering within the company


Minimum Qualifications:


Strong experience in machine learning, signal processing, and software development
Experience in building and deploying models that can accurately make inference from high-frequency sensor signals
Programming skills in languages such as Python
Familiarity with signal processing techniques and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, and Pandas
Experience with data visualization tools such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Plotly
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras
Understanding of machine learning concepts, including supervised and unsupervised learning, regression, classification, clustering, and dimensionality reduction
Proven experience of working prioritizing and working efficiently, to drive the most impactful work forwards
Proven experience with Machine Learning model pipeline, topology and architecture, hyper-parameter optimization


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with wearable device data, or other low-level sensor data sources
Experience with transfer learning, domain adaptation, and few-shot learning
Familiarity with Explainable AI techniques and libraries such as LIME, SHAP, or TreeExplainer
Certification in machine learning, data science, or a related field


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

HTML:
Meta is embarking on the most transformative change to its business and technology in company history, and our Machine Learning Engineers are at the forefront of this evolution. We are seeking a high skilled Machine Learning Engineer to join our team in developing cutting-edge algorithms for future Meta's wearables devices.

Software Engineer, Machine Learning Responsibilities:

  • Build, iterate and optimize models and experiment to build state-of-the-art performance within wearable devices constraints
  • Develop and implement data augmentation techniques to improve model performance and robustness
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, software developers, and clinical experts, to integrate ML models into existing systems and products
  • Evaluate and optimize model performance using various metrics and techniques, such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, and ROC-AUC
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning, signal processing and related fields. Apply this knowledge to improve model performance and innovation
  • Document and communicate technical findings and results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to the development of best practices for ML engineering within the company

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Strong experience in machine learning, signal processing, and software development
  • Experience in building and deploying models that can accurately make inference from high-frequency sensor signals
  • Programming skills in languages such as Python
  • Familiarity with signal processing techniques and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, and Pandas
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Plotly
  • Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras
  • Understanding of machine learning concepts, including supervised and unsupervised learning, regression, classification, clustering, and dimensionality reduction
  • Proven experience of working prioritizing and working efficiently, to drive the most impactful work forwards
  • Proven experience with Machine Learning model pipeline, topology and architecture, hyper-parameter optimization

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with wearable device data, or other low-level sensor data sources
  • Experience with transfer learning, domain adaptation, and few-shot learning
  • Familiarity with Explainable AI techniques and libraries such as LIME, SHAP, or TreeExplainer
  • Certification in machine learning, data science, or a related field

About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer | Zürich | CHF150.000
Description:
Job Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Zürich (80-100%)

Salary: Up to CHF 150.000 per year




Role Overview:

Optimus Search has partnered with a leading software development company based in Zürich. As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will be responsible for balancing responsibilities between software engineering and machine learning, as well as scaling the company's team size and processing volume.




Responsibilities:

Create and build efficient, maintainable software solutions in Python by applying industry best practices and design patterns, while ensuring high-quality code.
Perform code reviews and offer constructive feedback to maintain the quality and consistency of the codebase.
Connect the business requirements with the technical solution, emphasizing the selection of the most suitable tools for the task.
Design and maintain custom transformer-based NLP architectures.
Stay informed on cutting-edge research, extract valuable insights, and apply them to enhance our models.
Contribute to all stages of the end-to-end prediction service, including data management, model enhancements, monitoring, and scalability.




Requirements:

A master's degree (ETH, Uni) in computer science, physics or mathematics.
5+ years professional experience with software development in any object-oriented programming language (C#, C++, Java, Python), as well as experience coding in F#, Haskell, Scala.
Solid experience in machine learning processes, ideally within NLP and building data pipelines.
Experience with the entire Product Development Life Cycle, from design, implementation, deployment and acting on user feedback.
Structured and self-reliant approach.




Compensation:

Generous salary of up to CHF150.000 depending on experience
Flexible working hours, with the opportunity for substantial hybrid working
The option to have part of your salary paid in shares in the company
Work in a modern, centrally located office in Zürich
The chance for bonuses at the end of the year
