Title: Internship in GenAI/MLOps (m/f) 80-100%
Description:
Local integration of a large language model to accelerate software development

In this internship, you will work at the intersection of Generative AI and MLOps, focusing on the local deployment and integration of a large language model (LLM) to enhance software development workflows. You will take a hands-on approach to setting up, fine-tuning, and integrating an LLM within a sandboxed environment, contributing directly to innovative AI-driven development tools.

You will collaborate closely with a dedicated DevOps team while also receiving guidance from ML engineers through regular meetings and knowledge-sharing sessions. Your work will involve indexing AutoForm’s code base using LLM-powered semantic search, developing a simple web interface for intuitive code retrieval, and embedding AI-assisted capabilities into an IDE-based copilot. This role provides an opportunity to work with state-of-the-art AI technologies while tackling real-world software engineering challenges.

Your tasks


Set up a large language model in a local sandbox
Index AutoForm's code base using an LLM and elastic search to enable semantic search queries
Create and host a simple web interface allowing to search for code using semantic search
Integrate the LLM into a copilot running in an IDE
Fine-tune model on AutoForm's code base for better results


Your profile


Master's degree (or in the process of obtaining one) in computer science, data science, or engineering
Very good programming skills in Python and familiarity with at least one of the common machine learning frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX
Knowledge of modern neural architectures, especially in natural language processing would be a plus
Basic knowledge in web/app development
Strong technical interest, willingness to get involved in complex technical issues
Team Player with a strong commitment to problem solving
Good knowledge of English required. German would be a plus


Our offer


A challenging role in a respectful and global working environment
Being part of a world-leading, high-end CAE software company
Working on cutting edge technologies for the automotive industry
Professional development and continuous education
Excellent balance between your working life and your private life through flexible working hours


This role is based in Zurich. The duration at 100% workload is 6 months. The minimum workload is 80%, extending the duration accordingly.

Start of work is as soon as possible. Please note that we only consider applicants that have the legal right to work in the respective location. We will only consider direct applications. Please send us your CV and attachments. We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Processing of applicant’s personal data is based on our Data Privacy Policy

Title: Research Scientist, Machine Learning, Lausanne
Description:
Isomorphic Labs is a new Alphabet company that is reimagining drug discovery through a computational- and AI-first approach.

We are on a mission to accelerate the speed, increase the efficacy and lower the cost of drug discovery. You'll be working at the cutting edge of the new era of 'digital biology' to deliver a transformative social impact for the benefit of millions of people.

Come and be part of an interdisciplinary team driving groundbreaking innovation and play a meaningful role in contributing towards us achieving our ambitious goals, while being a part of an inspiring, collaborative and entrepreneurial culture.

Your impact

As a Research Scientist in machine learning (ML), you will play an exciting role in building greenfield machine learning based models and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

Working in a highly creative, fast-paced and interdisciplinary environment, you will be partnering with leading engineers and scientists to conceive, design, and develop cutting edge machine learning algorithms to unlock new modelling and predictive power which will be critical to the organisation’s success. You will draw upon your existing deep research experience whilst learning from those around you, to apply novel techniques and ideas to newly encountered computational biology and chemistry problems.

Depending on your experience:

You will create and lead projects, bringing together a variety of disciplined scientists and engineers to pursue some of the most ambitious modelling problems with deep learning - as well as providing technical mentorship and people management for others in the ML community at Isomorphic Labs

You will be instrumental in leading greenfield machine learning based research projects, building the models, and algorithms that will power our platform to transform the drug discovery world as we know it.

What You Will Do


Contribute to our research directions in machine learning by using your extensive knowledge of the field to apply world-leading ML algorithms to drug discovery.
Identify and create novel ML techniques and the required data to train.
Develop the architectures and training algorithms of machine learning models.
Analyse and tune experimental results to inform future experimental directions.
Implement and scale training and inference engineering frameworks.
Report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, to both other ML scientists and scientists of different disciplines.
Iterate collaboratively with scientists and domain experts, sharing your own domain experience.
Suggest and engage in team collaborations to meet ambitious research goals.
Depending on your experience:
Provide technical mentorship and guidance to the ML research community, advising on projects, and shaping our research roadmap based on your deep technical expertise.
Provide developmental support to other ML research scientists.
Create, lead, and run ML research projects, fostering collaborative and diverse teams to solve high priority modelling problems.Cultivate a diverse and inclusive research culture.


Essential

Skills and qualifications


PhD or equivalent practical experience in a technical field.
A proven track record in machine learning using deep learning techniques, including designing new architectures, hands-on experimentation, analysis, and visualisation.
Strong knowledge of linear algebra, calculus and statistics.
Experience using ML frameworks such as JAX, PyTorch, or TensorFlow, and scientific software such as NumPy, SciPy, or Pandas.
A passion for applying ML research to real world problems.
Depending on your experience: project supervision, leadership, or management.


Nice to have


PhD in machine learning or computer science.
Relevant research experience to the position such as post doctoral roles, a proven track record of publications, or contributions to machine learning codebases.
Experience working in a scientific environment across disciplines (particularly biology, chemistry, physics).
Experience working with biological or chemical data and biological or chemistry software.
Experience working with real-world datasets.
Experience with ML on accelerators.
Experience in any of: large scale deep learning, generative models, graph neural networks, deep learning for drug discovery, deep learning for computer vision, 3D graphics/robotics, real-world applied RL.


Culture and values

We are guided by our shared values. It's not about finding people who think and act in the same way. These values help to guide our work and will continue to strengthen it.

Thoughtful

Thoughtful at Iso is about curiosity, creativity and care. It is about good people doing good, rigorous and future-making science every single day.

Brave

Brave at Iso is about fearlessness, but it’s also about initiative and integrity. The scale of the challenge demands nothing less.

Determined

Determined at Iso is the way we pursue our goal. It’s a confidence in our hypothesis, as well as the urgency and agility needed to deliver on it. Because disease won’t wait, so neither should we.

Together

Together at Iso is about connection, collaboration across fields and catalytic relationships. It’s knowing that transformation is a group project, and remembering that what we’re doing will have a real impact on real people everywhere.

Creating An Inclusive Company

We believe that to be successful we need our teams to reflect and represent the populations we are striving to serve. We’re working to build a supportive and inclusive environment where collaboration is encouraged, learning is shared and every employee feels like they truly belong. We value diversity of experience, knowledge, backgrounds and perspectives, and harness these qualities to create extraordinary impact.

We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding) or any other basis protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Hybrid working

It’s hugely important for us to share knowledge and build strong relationships with each other, and we find it easier to do this if we spend time together in person. This is why we follow a hybrid model, and would require you to be able to come into the office 3 days a week (currently Tuesday, Wednesday, and one other day depending on which team you’re in). As an equal opportunities employer, we are committed to building an equal and inclusive team. If you have additional needs that would prevent you from following this hybrid approach, we’d be happy to talk through these if you’re selected for an initial screening call.

Please note that when you submit an application, your data will be processed in line with our privacy policy.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.




We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.




🚀 Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!


Tasks



Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.


Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.


Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.


Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.


Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.


Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.



Requirements



Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.


Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.


Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.


Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.


Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.


Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.


Fluent in English (German is a plus).



Benefits



Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.


Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).


Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.


Competitive salary & benefits.


Collaboration with AI & cloud experts shaping the future of AI.





Pixel Plus is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
Description:
Software Engineer, Machine Learning




About Chipmind

Chipmind is transforming chip development with AI-driven agents that automate design and verification by solving real-world tasks, accelerating the path from code to chip.




Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role at Chipmind for a Software Engineer, Machine Learning focused on post-training and AI agents. Join us to accelerate the path from code to chip and push the boundaries of AI-driven chip development.




What we offer

The opportunity to make an impact on how AI develops chips
A competitive compensation package including company equity
An office in the vibrant Zurich Wiedikon district




Qualifications

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python and Javascript
Familiar with large language models (LLMs) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Pytorch and TensorFlow)
Familiar with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud) and containerization (e.g., Docker)
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a strong passion for innovation




Responsibilities

Develop and enhance LLMs and AI agents for improved reasoning and decision-making
Implement RLHF, SFT, DPO, and other post-training methods
Fine-tune LLMs and optimize foundation models
Take part in brainstorming sessions and actively contribute to enhancing our products 
Keep up-to-date with the latest industry trends and developments in AI and machine learning technologies
Ensure robust model alignment and performance

Title: Vision Engineer
Description:
À propos de l'entreprise




Mikron Automation est votre partenaire mondial en solutions d’automatisation avancées. Engagés à fournir les meilleurs systèmes d’assemblage et services tout au long du cycle de vie de vos produits, nous mettons à profit notre savoir-faire en ingénierie, notre expertise en processus complexes, nos plateformes évolutives et notre support durable pour assurer le succès à long terme de nos clients.




À propos du rôle




En tant que Spécialiste en vision industrielle, vous serez impliqué dans la configuration, les tests et l’optimisation des systèmes de vision pour garantir leur conformité aux exigences clients. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l’évaluation de la faisabilité des solutions, la configuration matérielle et logicielle des systèmes, ainsi que dans les interventions techniques en interne et chez les clients.




Responsabilités




Configuration et validation des systèmes

Effectuer les évaluations et essais de faisabilité en réponse aux demandes d’offres.
Configurer les systèmes livrés en fonction des spécifications client, tant au niveau matériel (réglage optique) que logiciel (programmation et paramétrage).
Tester les systèmes pour garantir leur bon fonctionnement conformément au cahier des charges jusqu'à leur acceptation finale (Factory Acceptance Test).
Assurer la réalisation des corrections éventuelles en collaboration avec les services concernés.
Documenter précisément l’état final des systèmes (optique, logiciels, paramètres et configuration).




Suivi et interventions

Garantir l’exécution des activités dans le respect des délais et des coûts définis par le chef de projet.
Intervenir en interne et en externe pour la mise en service, l’acceptation client, les mises à jour, les dépannages et les formations (20-30% de déplacements).




Profil du candidat




Formation et expérience

Diplôme de Technicien ET ou Ingénieur HES en vision industrielle, traitement d’images, robotique ou automation (un atout).
Expérience avec les produits Cognex et/ou Keyence (un avantage).
Connaissances de base d’un langage de programmation orienté objet sous Windows (Microsoft Visual C++, Microsoft Visual Basic ou Microsoft Visual Basic.NET).
Connaissances en architecture PC/Réseau et software temps réel (un plus).




Compétences linguistiques

Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais (minimum B2).
Connaissance de l’allemand (un avantage).




Nous vous offrons




L’opportunité de relever des défis variés et d’évoluer au sein d’une société internationale axée sur la satisfaction client et l’innovation technologique.
Un environnement de travail moderne, agile et multiculturel favorisant l’échange de connaissances et le développement personnel et professionnel.
Une gestion de projets centrée sur l’humain et des équipes pluridisciplinaires dynamiques.
Un poste avec des perspectives d’évolution et un accès à la formation continue pour accompagner votre développement.
Un équilibre entre vie privée et vie professionnelle dans une entreprise soucieuse du bien-être de ses collaborateurs.
Show more

Title: Scientific Employee for NLP and Machine Learning (f/x/m)
Description:
60-100%

The Data Science Lab (DSL), www.dsl.unibe.ch, is a core facility at the University of Bern. The main DSL objective is the university-wide research support in Natural Language Processing (NLP), AI, Data Science and Research IT related matters.

Tasks (% are indicative only and relative to the employment %)


Consulting for researchers and research groups (20%).


Fictive example: A researcher from the Faculty of Theology: “I would like to do an automatic semantic comparison of the gospels, including the non-canonical Gospel of Thomas. Can you help me?”. You: “Sure, can I come to your office tomorrow?”


Project work (60%). Concrete example: Design, develop and maintain a web application for text and speech commanded retrieval and data analysis of results from large research projects, starting with a climate project.
Own continuing education (10%)
Teaching (5%)
Team internal stuff (5%)


Requirements


University or University of Applied Sciences degree, PhD is an asset
Experience and domain knowledge in NLP, ML and AI
Familiar with NLP/ ML frameworks and libraries such as Pytorch, Hugging Face, Spacy, Langchain.
Good understanding of state-of-the-art NLP models including transformer based Large Language Models.
[Nice to have] Experience with designing workflows integrating Rest APIs with Web Frameworks.
Experience and or interest in research and publication work
Goal and service-oriented personality with good English communication skills, German ones are an asset


We offer


Scientific staff employment for 2 years with possible extension
International and university-wide research environment
Extremely nice, multidisciplinary and engaged team
Learning on the job
Offices close to the main railway station of Bern, the best city on the planet
Conditions according to cantonal regulations and flexible working hours
Time for own continuing education and development
All amenities of university employees


We also strongly recommend women to apply for this position. For further information, please contact info.dsl@unibe.ch. Applications with at least two reference contacts are accepted until the position is filled. Please apply via email to the above address with your CV, diplomas, and job references.

Send your application as a single PDF file.

www.karriere.unibe.ch Legal Notice

Apply now
Show more

Title: Head of Data Science and AI
Description:
Summary

The Head of Data Science and AI will be responsible for leading the vision and strategy of the Data Science & AI team. This role aims to address unmet medical and process needs and drive innovation in line with the R&D AI strategy. The individual will promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across Novartis teams and supporting functions in Development, ensuring alignment with overall R&D and business goals.

This leader will act as a role model, elevating Data Science and AI as a strategic function. They will help Novartis leverage the latest AI innovations and gain external recognition as a leader in the field. They will possess a broad range of data and digital skills, mentor at the highest level, and serve as an enterprise leader.

Additionally, the Head of Data Science and AI will focus on attracting and retaining top talent, developing and empowering the team to reach their full potential, and forming top-tier external partnerships. They will provide guidance and coaching while maintaining a disciplined approach with clear accountabilities.

About The Role

Major accountabilities:


Design and implement an efficient operating model for elevating the function of Data Science and AI, overall responsible for converting cutting-edge technology and data science advancements into solutions serving strategic objectives of the Novartis Development Organization
Develop and lead a strategy and vision for Data Science & AI that aligns with and influences other functions to establish common goals, scientific questions and business objectives
Build and mentor a high-performing AI team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and transparency
Drive development of Data Science and AI talent, including staffing, designing career pathways and development opportunities, creating exposure and connectivity across the Development organization and beyond.
Drive discovery and implementation of innovative advanced analytics and models/algorithms to generate insights that significantly impact success, cost, and timelines
Developing and implementing the overall strategy for machine learning engineering and infrastructure for current and future AI solutions together with DDIT and other technology-related counterparts
Engage non-technical audiences and influence non-analytical Enterprise Business Leaders to drive major strategic decisions based on analytical inputs and drive data-driven decision-making
Ensure exemplary communication with all stakeholders, including internal associates and Enterprise business leaders
Drive a data-centric and innovative cultural mindset change across NVS to enable data generation, broad use, capability building, and advanced analytics and AI adoption
Lead by example in promoting a collaborative and entrepreneurial culture and mindset. Be an agent for change and engage support for innovative ideas, methods, technologies, partnerships, and solutions, and ensure responsible use of AI technologies
Identify and manage external workforce
Demonstrate internal and external presence that brings recognition of Novartis as a leader and innovator in Data Science and AI
Serve as a member of the Process Innovation and AI Leadership Team


Minimum Requirements


Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field
Minimum 10 years of relevant experience in Data Science with a track record of delivering global solutions at scale in healthcare settings, with a strong preference for experience in the Drug Development space.
In-depth mastery of the external Data Science and AI environment and trends.
A minimum of 5 years leadership experience with a track record of managing multidisciplinary teams and strong mentorship experience with the ability to lead and influence at the highest levels of the organization.
Strong professional network across Academia would be an advantage.
Extensive experience with managing change with organisational savviness and stakeholder engagement


Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Machine Learning Evangelist @AI Startup
Description:
Lightly AG is an official ETH and HSG Spin-off in the field of machine learning and computer vision. Its products are used by leading companies in autonomous driving, medical imaging, and visual inspection to curate visual machine learning data.




Lightly consists of a small team of talented developers, researchers, and business developers in Zurich, who all have a massive impact on the business and product. The company is backed by Y-Combinator, Wingman Ventures, and Soma Capital.


Tasks


At Lightly, our mission is to drive the democratization of artificial intelligence through open-source innovation. Our flagship repository, Lightly, is the leading framework for training self-supervised and foundation models.




We believe in a community-driven approach to AI advancement and strive to empower developers and organizations with the tools they need to create transformative AI solutions. Our open-source commitment is central to this mission, fostering collaboration and innovation within the global AI community.




As a Machine Learning Evangelist at Lightly, you will be a key player in our mission to build and nurture a vibrant open-source community. You will engage directly with developers, data scientists, and AI enthusiasts to promote Lightly, create compelling technical content, and contribute to the ongoing development of our platform




Responsibilities:




Community Engagement (20% of time)





Actively participate in community forums, including GitHub, Stack Overflow, and Slack/Discord channels, addressing questions and fostering discussions.


Organize and host virtual meetups, webinars, and other community events to engage and grow our user base.


Develop and manage community programs, such as ambassador or advocate initiatives, to encourage community involvement and contribution.





Content Creation (40% of time)





Generate high-quality technical content, including blog posts, tutorials, screencasts, and conference talks that educate and inspire our community.


Collaborate with the product and engineering teams to produce content that highlights new features, use cases, and best practices.





Product Contribution (40% of time)





Contribute to the development of Lightly, particularly in areas related to community feedback and user experience improvements.


Assist in the creation of product documentation and guides to ensure ease of use for new and existing users.



Requirements


Who we are looking for:





Professional experience in machine learning or data science (2+ years preferred).


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.


Proficiency in Python and familiarity with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.


Experience with open-source projects, either as a maintainer or active contributor.


Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to create engaging technical content.


Passion for building and nurturing community relationships and fostering a collaborative environment.





Nice to Have:





Experience with computer vision applications.


Prior experience in a developer advocacy or technical marketing role.


Familiarity with collaborative development tools (e.g., GitHub, Slack).





Important: We believe in people who are driven by curiosity and are willing to learn and take the next step. Please also reach out if you don't exactly "check all these boxes".


Benefits



Competitive salary, depending on experience.


Equity options to share in the success of our company.


Flexible working hours and a remote-friendly work environment.


Comprehensive benefits package, including financial support for sports/health, mobility, and education.


Opportunities for professional growth and development in an innovative and supportive team.


Optional: Office in the heart of Zurich next to the central station with Snacks


Company events, retreats, and offsites





If you're passionate about AI and open source, and you thrive in a community-centric environment, we'd love to hear from you!




Apply Now: Please include your resume, a cover letter, and links to any relevant projects or content you've created.

Apply Now: Please include your resume, a cover letter, and links to any relevant projects or content you've created.

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer, Cognitive Sciences
Description:
Logitech is the Sweet Spot for people who want their actions to have a positive global impact while having the flexibility to do it in their own way.

The Team and Role:

Logitech’s Technology Office has the mission of defining and implementing the company’s technology strategy. The group aims to bring state-of-the-art technologies and capabilities to Logitech’s R&D and business groups, and enable breakthrough innovations.

The Technology Office hosts a team of world-class scientists and engineers with expertise in computer science, robotics, human-machine interaction, cognitive sciences, machine learning and artificial intelligence. The activities of the group, based on the EPFL Innovation Park, Lausanne (Switzerland), span spatial computing, biosensing, immersive video and audio processing. We are looking for a talented AI/ML Engineer with domain expertise in Cognitive Sciences to lead our Biosensing exploration based on our own work and in collaboration with academic partners.

Your Contribution:

Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. Share our passion for Equality and the Environment. These are the behaviors and values you’ll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will:


Design and implement advanced algorithms and AI models to process biosignal data, bringing new insights to Logitech’s technology ecosystem.
Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to prototype new applications, exploring the potential of human-centered technologies that support cognitive and sensory experiences.
Stay on the cutting edge of biosensing and cognitive science developments, applying best practices and emerging methods to create meaningful user solutions.
Contribute to a culture of innovation by sharing knowledge, driving research projects, and engaging in scientific and industry discussions.


Key Qualifications:

For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and experiences to our team:


5+ year of relevant work or academic experience in applied research in the field of biosignal processing (EEG, ECG, breathing, gaze, etc.)
Proven hands-on experience in signal processing development incl. DSP, AI, ML and Deep Learning techniques.
Experience in software development and prototyping incl. data acquisition frameworks (e.g. LSL, PsychoPy, etc.), GUI (e.g. PyQT) and Windows applications development.
General purpose programming languages including Python and C/C++.
Knowledge of loss modeling, multimodal training, supervised, unsupervised and self-supervised learning.
Deep learning framework such as PyTorch or Tensorflow as well as ONNX models representation.
Authoring and peer review of scientific publications.
Experience in hardware design and development. Basic knowledge of material science and electronics.
Experience in scientific research and collaborations.
Keen interest in the field of human performance and wellbeing.
Pragmatic attitude, quick learner and ability to rapidly dive in new scientific fields.
Keen interest in people’s visual and interaction experiences.
Innovative, curious, self-starter & autonomous.
Desire to collaborate with internal peers and external partners.
Design, training and evaluation of deep neural networks


Across Logitech we empower collaboration and foster play. We help teams collaborate/learn from anywhere, without compromising on productivity or continuity so it should be no surprise that most of our jobs are open to work from home from most locations. Our hybrid work model allows some employees to work remotely while others work on-premises. Within this structure, you may have teams or departments split between working remotely and working in-house.

Logitech is an amazing place to work because it is full of authentic people who are inclusive by nature as well as by design. Being a global company, we value our diversity and celebrate all our differences. Don’t meet every single requirement? Not a problem. If you feel you are the right candidate for the opportunity, we strongly recommend that you apply. We want to meet you!

We offer comprehensive and competitive benefits packages and working environments that are designed to be flexible and help you to care for yourself and your loved ones, now and in the future. We believe that good health means more than getting medical care when you need it. Logitech supports a culture that encourages individuals to achieve good physical, financial, emotional, intellectual and social wellbeing so we all can create, achieve and enjoy more and support our families. We can’t wait to tell you more about them being that there are too many to list here and they vary based on location.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

If you require an accommodation to complete any part of the application process, are limited in the ability, are unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us toll free at +1-510-713-4866 for assistance and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Be Yourself. Be Open. Stay Hungry and Humble. Collaborate. Challenge. Decide and just Do. Share our passion for Equality and the Environment. These are the behaviors and values you’ll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will:

  • Design and implement advanced algorithms and AI models to process biosignal data, bringing new insights to Logitech’s technology ecosystem.
  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team to prototype new applications, exploring the potential of human-centered technologies that support cognitive and sensory experiences.
  • Stay on the cutting edge of biosensing and cognitive science developments, applying best practices and emerging methods to create meaningful user solutions.
  • Contribute to a culture of innovation by sharing knowledge, driving research projects, and engaging in scientific and industry discussions.

Key Qualifications:

For consideration, you must bring the following minimum skills and experiences to our team:

  • 5+ year of relevant work or academic experience in applied research in the field of biosignal processing (EEG, ECG, breathing, gaze, etc.)
  • Proven hands-on experience in signal processing development incl. DSP, AI, ML and Deep Learning techniques.
  • Experience in software development and prototyping incl. data acquisition frameworks (e.g. LSL, PsychoPy, etc.), GUI (e.g. PyQT) and Windows applications development.
  • General purpose programming languages including Python and C/C++.
  • Knowledge of loss modeling, multimodal training, supervised, unsupervised and self-supervised learning.
  • Deep learning framework such as PyTorch or Tensorflow as well as ONNX models representation.
  • Authoring and peer review of scientific publications.
  • Experience in hardware design and development. Basic knowledge of material science and electronics.
  • Experience in scientific research and collaborations.
  • Keen interest in the field of human performance and wellbeing.
  • Pragmatic attitude, quick learner and ability to rapidly dive in new scientific fields.
  • Keen interest in people’s visual and interaction experiences.
  • Innovative, curious, self-starter & autonomous.
  • Desire to collaborate with internal peers and external partners.
  • Design, training and evaluation of deep neural networks

Across Logitech we empower collaboration and foster play. We help teams collaborate/learn from anywhere, without compromising on productivity or continuity so it should be no surprise that most of our jobs are open to work from home from most locations. Our hybrid work model allows some employees to work remotely while others work on-premises. Within this structure, you may have teams or departments split between working remotely and working in-house.

Logitech is an amazing place to work because it is full of authentic people who are inclusive by nature as well as by design. Being a global company, we value our diversity and celebrate all our differences. Don’t meet every single requirement? Not a problem. If you feel you are the right candidate for the opportunity, we strongly recommend that you apply. We want to meet you!

We offer comprehensive and competitive benefits packages and working environments that are designed to be flexible and help you to care for yourself and your loved ones, now and in the future. We believe that good health means more than getting medical care when you need it. Logitech supports a culture that encourages individuals to achieve good physical, financial, emotional, intellectual and social wellbeing so we all can create, achieve and enjoy more and support our families. We can’t wait to tell you more about them being that there are too many to list here and they vary based on location.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

If you require an accommodation to complete any part of the application process, are limited in the ability, are unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us toll free at +1-510-713-4866 for assistance and we will get back to you as soon as possible.

Title: Video recording for - Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
Company: SWISS UMEF University of Applied Sciences Institute
Description:
SWISS UMEF Description:

SWISS UMEF University of Applied Sciences Institute, founded in Geneva in 1984, is officially accredited by the Swiss Accreditation Council.




Role Description:

This is a contract role for a Professor specialising in "Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning" at SWISS UMEF University of Applied Sciences Institute, located in Vernier. As a Professor, you will be responsible for recording lectures for our online students.




Qualifications:

PhD in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Machine Learning, or AI.
Extensive research experience with a track record of publications in leading AI journals and conferences.
5 years of teaching experience at the university level, preferably including graduate courses.
Experience in industry projects or research collaboration is highly desirable.
Technical proficiency with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch, as well as advanced programming skills in Python.
Demonstrable experience in securing research grants, mentoring students, and contributing to the professional community.
Strong communication skills and innovative teaching methodologies.

Qualifications:

  • PhD in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Machine Learning, or AI.
  • Extensive research experience with a track record of publications in leading AI journals and conferences.
  • 5 years of teaching experience at the university level, preferably including graduate courses.
  • Experience in industry projects or research collaboration is highly desirable.
  • Technical proficiency with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch, as well as advanced programming skills in Python.

  • Strong communication skills and innovative teaching methodologies.

Title: AI Ethics Research Scientist - Intern
Description:
Do you have a PhD or MSc with a relevant background in AI Ethics?
Are you looking for your next step toward AI / ML?
Do you want to be based in Zurich and work with a leading AI Research Lab?


If so, great! Apply here and let’s discuss your next challenge.

Sony Research is dedicated to driving innovation, advancing technology and ensuring that AI is developed responsibly, ethically, and inclusively. The AI Ethics team focuses on creating frameworks, tools, and methodologies that promote trust, transparency, fairness, and accountability in AI tools and technologies. See more details on the AI Ethics Team at Sony AI here: https://ai.sony/projects/ai-ethics/

We are seeking a motivated and passionate AI Ethics Intern to join our diverse team. As an intern, you will contribute to cutting-edge projects aimed at addressing ethical challenges in AI. This internship will provide you with hands-on experience in exploring ethical dimensions in AI research, offering a unique opportunity to work alongside researchers and engineers in a globally diverse team.

Learn More About Sony AI Here

www.linkedin.com/company/sonyai/life

https://ai.sony

Roles And Responsibilities

Responsibilities will depend on the project you are assigned to, and will include a combination of the following:


Conduct fundamental and innovative research in AI ethics, including but not limited to data collection, AI evaluation and algorithmic bias mitigation.
Be self-motivated and capable of proposing and implementing innovative ideas.
Contribute to the development of tools and frameworks to assess and mitigate AI-related risks in computer vision, such as bias, fairness, and transparency.
Set up technical experiments to conduct bias evaluations in computer vision, or conduct interviews on AI ethics-related topics
Contribute to creating training materials, guidelines, and best practices for responsible AI.
Publish influential research outcomes in top-tier conferences and journals.


Required Qualifications And Skills


Currently pursuing a degree (Masters or PhD) in Computer Science or socio-technical AI topics.
Strong interest in AI ethics and responsible AI development.
Familiarity with ethical principles and frameworks in AI, in particular algorithmic fairness, bias detection and mitigation
Strong understanding of AI and machine learning techniques in computer vision
Strong research, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Experience with programming languages, preferably Python.
Preferred: Experience with research communities, including having published papers at conferences/journals


Your New Office

Surrounded by Swiss Alps, the Schlieren office is at the doorstep of Zurich, which is consistently voted in top three best cities to live. The city benefits from a very rich ecosystem where prestigious universities, research institutes, companies and organizations collaborate for the development and design of next generation technologies. Our office is very well connected with public transports (train, tram, bus) and located in a very modern and bright building. We have several enjoyable break rooms as well as a terrace which we use for regular social team events or as a casual working area. Our team is unique and international, representing engineering and sales/marketing functions, which creates this unique and passionate Sony Swiss DNA.

Life At Sony Research

Our work environment is diverse and motivated with an innovative open mindset. Sony AI is committed to building a diverse team of people with different characters, stories and skillsets because we know this drives innovation and creativity. Our commitment to nurturing a friendly and supportive place of work where everyone has a sense of belonging and inclusion creates an atmosphere of learning and personal growth. We focus on achieving healthy work-life balance for our teams, supported by hybrid and flexible working.

You will work on exciting projects at the cutting edge of AI that are in the realms of entertainment or for the betterment of society, and you will have access to the most innovative technologies from across the Sony universe and the opportunity to partner with Sony’s leading companies.

When projects are finished, we publish our work, and all our contributors are recognised on research pieces, at top-tier conferences, and in journals. You will also have access to workshops and development programs to expand your knowledge and skills. We want you to drive your career, find your direction and take authorship of your personal story at Sony AI, while enjoying the security and the resource-rich environment that comes with being part of a global corporation that has R&D in its DNA.

Bring Your Uniqueness To Sony

We are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. We want employees with diverse backgrounds and perspectives that will stimulate innovation and have a direct impact on our creation of social value to fulfil Sony’s purpose – ‘to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology’. We want you to bring your unique self to work and help shape our culture.

Equal Opportunity

Sony Europe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, or any other protected characteristics.

Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Sony Europe

Sony Europe will provide reasonable accommodation for any qualified individuals with disabilities in the application process. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at AccommodationRequest@eu.sony.com or by mail to: Sony Europe B.V, Human Resources Department, the Heights, Brooklands, Surrey, KT13 0XW, UK. When contacting us please indicate the position you are applying for, and the accommodation required.


Show more

Equal Opportunity

Sony Europe is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, citizenship, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, medical condition, or any other protected characteristics.

Disability Accommodation for Applicants to Sony Europe

Sony Europe will provide reasonable accommodation for any qualified individuals with disabilities in the application process. For reasonable accommodation requests, please contact us by email at AccommodationRequest@eu.sony.com or by mail to: Sony Europe B.V, Human Resources Department, the Heights, Brooklands, Surrey, KT13 0XW, UK. Title: Principal Scientist – Crop Protection Research Chemistry (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

At our R&D Center in Stein AG, Switzerland, the Crop Protection Research (CPR) Chemistry team is at the forefront of innovation. Here, you will design and synthesize novel products that promote crop health and contribute to the evolution of agricultural practices. Your work will play a crucial role in advancing our mission to ensure global food security through sustainable solutions.

Syngenta has been ranked as a top employer by Science Magazine and it has been awarded with the "Friendly Work Space" label to all its Swiss sites.

Job Description

Your responsibilities:


Collaborate in multidisciplinary project teams with local and global experts to drive discovery programs to develop sustainable crop protection solutions.
Lead and contribute to chemistry research projects, applying state-of-art target-based discovery approaches to identify and optimize novel bioactive ingredients interacting with relevant biological targets for crop protection.
Advance project delivery through scientific investigations, applying expertise in molecular design, physical organic chemistry, and synthetic problem-solving.
Analyze and deconvolute complex structure-activity-relationships (SAR) by integrating experimental and predicted data to meet key project deliverables.
Drive scientific advancement and technological innovation in modern agrochemical discovery by proactively developing and applying cutting-edge skills and technologies, while fostering a culture of continuous learning, creativity, and strategic foresight.


Qualifications

What we are looking for:


Deep expertise in organic chemistry, chemical biology or medicinal chemistry through doctoral training; postdoctoral and/or industrial experience is valued, yet not essential.
Scientific experience in drug discovery technologies, and proficiency in synthetic organic chemistry.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills, with demonstrated ability to effectively participate in scientific collaborations, fostering productive teamwork in multidisciplinary environments
Forward-thinking mindset with a proactive approach to emerging trends and technologies in the field, coupled with strong self-motivation and initiative in project execution and personal growth.
Good English language skills with demonstrated ability to communicate complex scientific concepts effectively and enable cross-functional engagement.


What You Bring To Our Team


Passion for life science technologies, including small molecules and new chemical modalities.
Enthusiasm for applying and championing cutting-edge science and digital technologies.
Creativity, curiosity, and strong decision-making skills with a commitment to continuous learning.
Excellent organizational and time management abilities
Collaborative mindset with strong communication skills to build productive relationships within Syngenta and with international collaborators
Dedication to welcoming different perspectives and fostering a diverse, inclusive and open work environment.


Additional Information

What we offer:


We provide access to state-of-the-art research facilities and technologies, enabling you to apply and expand your expertise in agrochemical design principles, synthetic organic chemistry, and active ingredient optimization.
We cultivate a superb working environment with an open culture and diverse workforce, where new ideas are always welcome. We embrace flexible work arrangements and foster work-life balance.
We foster a digitally-enhanced research environment throughout our R&D processes. This offers you the opportunity to develop digital data analysis skills, positioning you at the forefront of drug discovery.
We invest in your professional growth and development through a multidisciplinary training program tailored to foster a rewarding career in crop protection.
We are part of a strong regional Science hub, offering you the opportunity to interact with a rich community of scientists in life sciences, further enhancing your professional network and knowledge exchange.
You will profit from a competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child and Family allowance…)


Are you interested? Please send your complete application with CV, cover letter, diploma and work certificates (if applicable).

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status
Show more

Title: Senior ML Engineer (Zürich)
Description:
You want to operate at the cutting edge of AI, building the strongest defenses in the AI cybersecurity market. You will be increasing the scope and quality of our defenses, and playing a pivotal role in ensuring that GenAI applications can be deployed securely at scale. You will lead the creation of cutting-edge models that perform exceptionally well and operate in real time. This involves continuously identifying edge cases for our detectors and working to collect and generate intricate threat datasets to improve the performance of these models. You will ensure that Lakera can continuously ship the best defenses in the market with a high cadence. Your passion lies in shaping the future, working on ideas that define the secure use of AI in the decades ahead. Your work will play a vital role in ensuring that AI can unleash its best potential–for good.

About Lakera

Lakera is on a mission to ensure AI does what we want it to do. We are heading towards a future where AI agents run our businesses and personal lives. Here at Lakera, we're not just dreaming about the future; we're building the security foundation for it. We empower security teams and builders so that their businesses can adopt AI technologies and unleash the next phase of intelligent computing.

We work with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and foundation model providers to protect them and their users from adversarial misalignment. We are also the company behind Gandalf, the world’s most popular AI security game.

Lakera has offices in San Francisco and Zurich.

We move fast and work with intensity. We act as one team but expect everyone to take substantial ownership and accountability. We prioritize transparency at every level and are committed to always raising the bar in everything we do. We promote diversity of thought as we believe that creates the best outcomes.

Example projects


Extend the scope of one of our detectors to support multiple languages without dropping performance on already supported languages.
Increase the scope where our defenses perform by 100x (e.g., multi-lingual data, code, etc).
Extend modeling and data generation to enable passing additional context to our prompt injection detectors, such as the LLM output and behavioral metadata.
Red team our model to understand the most pressing vulnerabilities of our detectors and prioritize the data collection and generation required to fix them.


What You’ll Bring


You have at least 4 years of experience shipping machine learning models to production, ideally in environments where reliability and quality are key (e.g., autonomous driving, industrial applications, healthcare).
Most of your experience productionizing ML models has been in unstructured data spaces such as NLP and vision.
You have had experience working on end-to-end development of ML models.
You have experience working on the “long tail” of data distribution, bringing models from prototypes to real-world systems.
You aspire to play a pivotal role in defining the future of secure AI within a mission-driven company with ambitious goals.


👉 Let's stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram to learn more about what is happening at Lakera.

ℹ️ Join us on Momentum, the slack community for AI Safety and Security everything.

❗To remove your information from our recruitment database, please email privacy@lakera.ai.
Show more

Title: Computer Vision/Machine Learning Internship
Description:
Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.

About The Internship

We are looking for students with a passion for computer vision or machine learning to join one of the teams in Zürich for four to six months. You will be a part of product development and you will help us improve and extend algorithms and their automated testing infrastructure.

Scandit offers an excellent opportunity to apply the theory from your studies while gaining hands-on experience with industry best practices in a international team.

What You Will Do

We have many interesting projects to offer. Depending on your background and interests, you could work on one of the following projects:


Improve barcode scanning algorithms in difficult scenarios such as surfaces with deformations, glare or reflections
Enhance the real-time visual tracking and pose estimation system of our solutions through the integration of additional sensor measurements and cutting-edge machine learning algorithms
Enhance our object and context detection systems by developing, refining, and integrating state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms tailored to our specific domain
Enhance our real-time visualization system to analyze and develop our computer vision algorithms
Reduce manual steps in our image annotation tools with smart algorithms
Develop image classification, matching and/or reconstruction features in order to improve the algorithms for understanding the current state of shelves and products in supermarkets


Our Tech Stack


Computer vision algorithms: C++17, CMake
Machine learning training and tooling, cloud processing: Python, Pytorch
Acceleration: SIMD, Vulkan, CoreML


Who You Are


Highly motivated student, interested in an internship of four months or longer
Enrolled in or completed a bachelor’s or master’s program in computer science, information technology, robotics or a related field
Solid knowledge of data structures and experience in object-oriented programming
You have taken courses in computer vision, image processing and/or machine learning
Ideally you already had some exposure to solving a computer vision problem in a semester project or thesis
If you are interested in working on the core image recognition algorithms, solid C++ programming skills will be needed
Python programming knowledge is a plus


What We Offer


We are certified as a “Great Place to Work” in 10 countries!
A highly skilled team and a fun environment where you can put your enthusiasm for computer vision challenges and cutting-edge technologies to use
Hackathons, summer parties, company outings and other regular events
Office in the city of Zürich (Hardbrücke)


Imagine The What. Build The How.

At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.

All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.

#engineering

#LOC-Hybrid


Show more
HTML:
Scandit gives people superpowers. Whether enabling delivery drivers to make quicker deliveries, matching a patient with their medication, or allowing retailers to make store operations more efficient, our technology automates workflows. It provides actionable insights to help businesses in a variety of industries. Join us as we continue to expand, grow, innovate, and help take Scandit to the next level.

About The Internship

We are looking for students with a passion for computer vision or machine learning to join one of the teams in Zürich for four to six months. You will be a part of product development and you will help us improve and extend algorithms and their automated testing infrastructure.

Scandit offers an excellent opportunity to apply the theory from your studies while gaining hands-on experience with industry best practices in a international team.

What You Will Do

We have many interesting projects to offer. Depending on your background and interests, you could work on one of the following projects:

  • Improve barcode scanning algorithms in difficult scenarios such as surfaces with deformations, glare or reflections
  • Enhance the real-time visual tracking and pose estimation system of our solutions through the integration of additional sensor measurements and cutting-edge machine learning algorithms
  • Enhance our object and context detection systems by developing, refining, and integrating state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms tailored to our specific domain
  • Enhance our real-time visualization system to analyze and develop our computer vision algorithms
  • Reduce manual steps in our image annotation tools with smart algorithms
  • Develop image classification, matching and/or reconstruction features in order to improve the algorithms for understanding the current state of shelves and products in supermarkets

Our Tech Stack

  • Computer vision algorithms: C++17, CMake
  • Machine learning training and tooling, cloud processing: Python, Pytorch
  • Acceleration: SIMD, Vulkan, CoreML

Who You Are

  • Highly motivated student, interested in an internship of four months or longer
  • Enrolled in or completed a bachelor’s or master’s program in computer science, information technology, robotics or a related field
  • Solid knowledge of data structures and experience in object-oriented programming
  • You have taken courses in computer vision, image processing and/or machine learning
  • Ideally you already had some exposure to solving a computer vision problem in a semester project or thesis
  • If you are interested in working on the core image recognition algorithms, solid C++ programming skills will be needed
  • Python programming knowledge is a plus

What We Offer

  • We are certified as a “Great Place to Work” in 10 countries!
  • A highly skilled team and a fun environment where you can put your enthusiasm for computer vision challenges and cutting-edge technologies to use
  • Hackathons, summer parties, company outings and other regular events
  • Office in the city of Zürich (Hardbrücke)

Imagine The What. Build The How.

At Scandit we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be a safe space for all.

All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability or length of time spent unemployed.

Title: Senior ML Research Engineer (Athens or Zurich)
Description:
Overview

As the Senior ML Research Engineer on the intelligent AV team, you will lead the adoption of cutting-edge machine learning models and algorithms, enhancing the awareness and perception engine behind Q-SYS VisionSuite. In close collaboration with our ML Architect, you will bridge the gap between state-of-the-art research and production systems. You will work alongside talented Software, Robotics, and Machine Learning Engineers to advance the next generation of intelligent audio-video systems for meeting spaces and smart buildings. Your key focus will be on driving innovation, expanding intelligent system capabilities, and shaping our data strategy, including collection and dataset curation, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.

Your Mindset

Innovative Thinker: Passionate about staying at the forefront of machine learning advancements and applying them to real-world challenges.

Scientist & Engineer: Driven to bridge the gap between research and practical applications, bringing the latest machine learning solutions into production.

Mentor and Advocate : Actively grow team members’ expertise and excitement about new advances.

This hybrid position is based in Zurich or Athens.

Responsibilities

Drive Innovation: Identify, experiment with, and implement cutting-edge ML algorithms, focusing on situational and perceptual awareness using ML techniques such as computer vision, sensor fusion and multimodal AI

Collaboration & Research Partnerships: Build partnerships with universities at the master’s or PhD level to keep up with state-of-the-art advances.

Integration into Production: Lead the integration of research innovations into production, in collaboration with the ML Architect.

Software Development: Contribute to and collaborate in our codebase following software development best practices.

Strategic Leadership: Inform the ML vision and roadmap, identifying high-impact trends, and develop and align data strategies to support experimentation, training, and evaluation.

Mentorship & Team Growth: Mentor team members, fostering a culture of innovation.

Hiring & Team Growth: Support recruitment efforts to expand the ML team.

Qualifications

Qualifications


PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or related fields, with a focus on machine learning, robotics, or similar.
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience deploying ML research in production environments within a collaborative and cross-disciplinary setting.
At least 1 year of experience leading teams or projects, with strong collaboration and mentorship skills.
Proficiency in Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow, or relevant ML frameworks.
Software engineering skills, with experience in Git, code reviews, CI/CD and design patterns.
Experience managing model lifecycles and data pipelines and ensuring real-time performance under constraints.
Academic research collaboration experience, supervising academic research and contributing to successful technology transfers.


Plus


Experience in developing models and algorithms for perception and situational awareness.
Familiarity with MLOps tools like Weights and Biases, MLflow, and experience with Docker.
Experience with ROS and C++.

Title: Azure AI/ ML Engineer
Description:
Mandatory Skills:

Primary skill : Microsoft Copilot Studio, Microsoft Power Platform, Microsoft Power Automate

Desired Skills

Nice to have : Experience with REST APIs, Azure AI/ML and native data engineering tech stack, Python




Roles and Responsibilities :

Hands on yrs of experience
Experience in designing and building high-performant AI agents and virtual chatbots using MS Copilot Studio.
Experience in automating workflows using Power Automate (e.g. calling APIs from Power Automate triggers)
Strong engineering mindset, with experience in using CI/CD, Git, Gitlab, automated testing
years of experience in developing AI and Machine learning workloads, especially in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Experience in building Generative AI solutions, virtual assistants and chatbots using Azure Open AI or any similar LLM’s (eg: GPT 4.0)
Expertise in Python programming for Data science workloads
Expertise in automation and production deployment of NLP and GenAI models using PowerApps.
Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and motivation to work in high performance and rewarding work environments

Title: Head of Data Science & Modeling R&D (f/m/d) 80-100%
Description:
Switzerland, Basel

Switzerland, Visp

Location, Visp.

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across five continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

The role's purpose and scope are to Lead the SM data science and modeling strategy/ roadmap across the business platform to generate unique insights from data and develop new differentiated offerings using modeling tools. The incumbent will lead a team of expert data scientists/engineers, programmers and modeling experts (AI, mechanistic, statistical) deployed across multiple projects to enable the deployment of industry-leading data science and modeling capabilities.

What You’ll Get


An agile career and dynamic working culture in a growing environment.
An inclusive and ethical workplace.
Compensation programs that recognize high performance.
A variety of competitive benefits.


What You’ll Do


Act as strategic lead for data science and modeling across the organization (R&D, MSAT, dev services, etc) and partner with relevant leads in other Business platforms.
Effectively manage resources and projects in line with prioritized business needs.
Support all business areas (chemistry, bio enhancement, oral drug product, drug delivery), functions (R&D, operations, quality, etc) and sites.
Ensure advanced data science and modeling is a key enabler across our innovation pipeline and operations.
Partner with IT Hub and spoke with contacts to ensure aligned strategy and investment.
Ensure effective deployment of data ops/flows and visualization and modeling tools in operations, and services, through simplified workbenches, workflows, and apps as well as training.
Accelerate the adoption of AI/ML as well as statistical and mechanistic modeling in the organization including through partnerships / external collaborations.
Work closely with other SMEs (IT, Automation, analytical, etc) to ensure alignment of project and priorities.


What We’re Looking For


PhD in Science, an equivalent professional qualification or occupational experience in Chemical engineering, statistics, chem-informatics/chemometrics .
Minimum of 10 years of experience leading/managing projects, including technology projects, in a pharmaceutical /CDMO setting .
Solid experience delivering strong value (new offerings, acceleration, etc) through the development and deployment of modeling tools in a pharmaceutical /CDMO environment.
Demonstrated ability to operate in a complex matrix environment.
Proven track record /scientific expertise in the development and deployment of complex modeling tools, programming, electronic lab notebooks, apps,etc
Established collaboration network and external recognition as SME in the field
Ability to operate at multiple levels from strategic planning to site operational deployment in line with broader R&D and BU objectives .
Support own and matrix team resource planning, project management activities and prioritization decisions.
Strong communication skills and capacity to translate technical information into business insights for decision-making process.


Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Reference: R66644

Title: Junior Software Engineer
Description:
Unsere Kundin ist ein kleineres, erfolgreiches Software-Unternehmen mit Kunden aus den Bereichen Produktion und Logistik. Die Business Logik ist komplex, die Projekte sind vielfältig und reichen von punktueller Unterstützung bis zum kompletten Outsourcing.




Junior Software Engineer




Was du bewirkst

Du entwickelst Software für Industrie, Produktion und Logistik in C#/NET.
Du löst komplexe Aufgabenstellungen und bringst dabei deine Algorithmikskills sowie dein analytisches Denken voll zum Tragen.
Du arbeitest eng mit den anderen Software Engineers sowie mit den Projektleiter:innen zusammen.
Ein Senior Software Engineer begleitet dich als Ansprechperson und Mentor.




Was du mitbringst

Abgeschlossenes Masterstudium in Informatik, ETH-/Uni-Masterstudium in einer naturwissenschaftlichen Studienrichtung (Elektrotechnik, Mathematik, Physik u.a.)
Ausgeprägte Stärke im analytischen und konzeptionellen Denken
Du übernimmst Verantwortung und arbeitest selbständig sowie gerne auch mit anderen zusammen.
Erste Erfahrungen oder Grundverständnis im Software Engineering




Was dir diese Stelle bietet

Spannende, vielfältige Aufgabenstellungen vom Konzept bis zur Realisierung
Die Geschäftsleitungsmitglieder sind selbst Software Engineers und auch operativ tätig.
Schweizer Software, zu 100 Prozent. Kein Near- und Offshoring.
Einen Arbeitsplatz in Gehdistanz zum Bahnhof Luzern.
Show more

Title: Développeur Blockchain Solana H/F
Description:
About

INTRODUCTION:

Dans Le Cadre D'une Mission, Nous Vous Proposons De Rejoindre Les Équipes D'une Structure En Pleine Croissance Active Dans Le Secteur De La Finance Décentralisée En Qualité De

Consultant Blockchain Solana H/F

Description De La Mission


Concevoir et développer une solution permettant de bridger un stablecoin synthétique d'Ethereum vers Solana de manière sécurisée et efficace.
Évaluer les solutions existantes (protocoles de bridge, wrapping, smart contracts, etc.) et proposer la meilleure approche technique.
Développer et auditer les smart contracts nécessaires sur Ethereum et Solana.
Assurer l'intégration avec les protocoles de finance décentralisée (DeFi) sur Solana.
Implémenter des mécanismes de sécurisation et de validation des transferts pour garantir la stabilité et la fiabilité du bridge.
Collaborer avec les équipes DevOps et Sécurité pour optimiser la performance et l'efficacité des transactions cross-chain.
Tester, documenter et déployer la solution en conditions réelles.


Profil Attendu


Expérience confirmée en développement blockchain (Ethereum, Solana, Rust, Solidity).
Bonne connaissance des protocoles de bridge inter-chaînes et des solutions cross-chain existantes.
Expérience en développement de smart contracts et en audit de sécurité blockchain.
Familiarité avec les protocoles DeFi et les concepts de stablecoins synthétiques.
Capacité à travailler en autonomie sur un projet complexe et innovant.
Une expérience avec des solutions de wrapping de tokens est un plus.


Modalités

Lieu : Remote ou hybride selon localisation, canton de Vaud (CH)

Durée : 6 mois

Rémunération : TJM à discuter selon profil

Si vous êtes passionné(e) par les enjeux d'interopérabilité blockchain et souhaitez travailler sur un projet innovant dans la DeFi, envoyez-nous votre candidature !

Nice-to-have skills


Blockchain
Ethereum
Rust
Solidity
Smart Contracts
Vaud, Switzerland


Work experience


Blockchain


Languages


French
